This will not only help him to grow his milk selling business but will increase his net income and savings as well. He hopes to provide quality education for his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a shop.

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna is a 44-year-old woman who is married to Ravi in Dhupguri village. Both of them are illiterate but can sign their names only. They are blessed with three children. All are studying in school. Swapna is managing household work all day long while her husband has been farming different kinds of seasonal vegetables for many years. Her husband sells his products to the village market hence he cannot generate sufficient income for his family. Swapna is facing many financial hurdles to leading a normal life, so that she is unable to run her family smoothly. She decided to give her husband financial support. She came to know that Kiva’s partner, BJS, lends money to rural women for business. 

Swapna applied for a loan from BJS to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to grow potatoes and sell them in the local market. She lives in a kaccha house (made of mud and straw). In future she dreams of a concrete house of her own with the profits from her potato business. She sincerely thanks BJS and Kiva for the support.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of potatoes

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 27-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of  four children. Her husband is a van driver by profession. For the past many days the engine of the van has not worked properly.  Because of this he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the engine. Therefore Saima has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing. This will help him to continue his business. Saima is very much thankful to KIVA.

loans.use: to help her husband cover the cost of repairing van's engine.

loans.name: Mayson

texts.en:
Mayson is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Mayson is a 29-year-old married woman from Nablus city.  She lives with her husband in a simple house in the city.  For the past five years, Mayson and her husband have been working in a small electrical store they own.  It is located in a good area in the city and they have their loyal customers. 

Mayson requested a USD loan from FATEN.   This loan helps Mayson to help her husband buy more products for their electrical store to resell.  By taking this loan, the store will be improved.

loans.use: to help her husband buy more products for their electrical store to resell

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio es separado y tiene dos hijos ambos estan en el colegio, viven en casa en la casa de sus hermanos, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente el tiene un pequeño taller de carpinteria donde elabora juegos de dormitorios matrimoniales, con la ayuda de sus hijos.
El crédito lo requiere para  la compra de materia prima: madera, tableros, pinturas etc. Asi podra comprar al por mayor. En esta epoca de fin de año sus pepidos tienden a aumentar.
El sueño de Julio es que sus productos lleguen al interior del pais y el extranjero.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Julio is separated and has two children, both in school. They live in his brothers’ house, which is located in the Villa Cooperative area of the city of El Alto.

He studied until secondary school and currently has a small carpentry workshop where he makes double bedroom sets with the help of his children. He needs a loan to purchase raw material: wood, planks, paint, etc. Thus he will be able to buy wholesale. His orders tend to increase at the end of the year.

Julio’s dream is that his products will reach the interior of the country and even abroad. This is the third time he has applied for a loan from IMPRO and the first time from KIVA

loans.use: to purchase wood, planks, paints for his small carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose se dedica al servicio de la construccion como ayudante que pasara a contra-maestro. 
El vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en El Alto en la z/ Villa Bolivar Michmi, del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito que Jose requiere es para  comprar herramientas de trabajo, como ser picota,plomada, escuadra, carretilla, que le es de mucha necesidad para mejorar su  trabajo, asi poder brindar un buen servicio.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Jose works in construction as an assistant and will become a master tradesman. He lives in his parents' house on Villa Bolivar Michme in El Alto, about one hour from the city of La Paz in the department of La Paz. Jose needs a loan to buy work tools like a shovel, pick, plumb line, bracket, and wheelbarrow to improve his work and service. This is his second loan cycle with IMPRO and his first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy tools like a shovel, pick, plumb line, bracket, wheelbarrow that will be useful in his work as a bricklayer.

loans.name: Edith Del Carmen

texts.es: Edith tiene 25 años de edad y es madre soltera de tres hijas de 10 años, 8 años y 4 años de edad y habita junto a ellas en casa propia desde hace mucho tiempo. Edith es una mujer emprendedora quien hace todo lo que este a su alcance para ganarse el pan d cada día y dar a sus hijas mejores condiciones. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sorbete artesanal y este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos. Desea mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su vivienda ya que como se muestra en la fotografía los pilares son de madera y se encuentran deteriorados por causa de los insectos que anidan en ella. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en el cambio de los pilares de madera por columnas de concreto y además, poner lámina en la cubierta del techo. Con el crédito comprará cemento, arena, hierro y lámina.
texts.en:
Edith is 25 years, and is a single mother of three daughters ages 10, 8 and 4.  Together, they live in a house that she has owned for a long time.  Edith is an entrepreneurial woman who does all that she can to earn her daily bread and provide her daughters with better living conditions.  She works making and selling artisanal sorbet, a business that is her primary source of income.

She wishes to improve her housing conditions, because as can be seen in the picture, the pillars are made of wood, and have deteriorated because of insects that nest in it.  For this reason, she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in replacing the wooden posts with concrete columns, and put sheet metal on the roof.  With the loan, she will purchase cement, sand, iron and sheet metal.

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, iron, and sheet metal to build concrete columns and change the roof on her house.

loans.name: Ashuraly

texts.ru: Ашурали великодушный человек. Он родился в 1955 году. Ашурали женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Его дети совершеннолетние. Ашурали очень трудолюбивый человек и всегда старается для благо получения своей семьи. Ашурали занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Он предоставляет свои услуги местным жителям своего района. Он живет на юге Таджикистана. Ашурали привлекает клиентов благодаря хорошему сервису. Он должен провести свадебное торжество своей дочери, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ashuraly is a generous person.  He was born in 1955.  Ashuraly is married and raising 4 children.  His children are of age.  Ashuraly is a very hardworking person and always tries hard for his family's welfare.  Ashuraly is involved in providing a taxi service.  He provides his services to local residents of his district.  He lives in the south of Tajikistan.  Ashuraly attracts clients thanks to his good service.  He has to hold a wedding party for this daughter, but does not have money.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to hold a wedding party.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to hold a wedding party for his daughter

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines.

Guillerma requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more raw materials for her business, like abaca fiber.

Guillerma has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business, like abaca fiber.

loans.name: Henry's Group

texts.en:
Henry is a member of Upendo Group in Kakamega North District.  He is pictured here in a group of six One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 52 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Henry has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving farm inputs (hybrid seeds and fertilizer) for one quarter acre of maize and one quarter acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average loan of 5,349 KES.							

Henry is a reliable member of the community.  He is is 48 years old, married, with eight children.  Henry has been working as a farmer for the last 26 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Henry is very active in his community and is involved in a men's group and prayer group.  He described his harvest last year as good.  He hopes to continue to work with One Acre Fund and to enjoy the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.
							
The 2013 Long Rains season won’t be Henry’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He joined One Acre Fund in 2010 and has been working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, new farming methods, fertilizer, and hybrid seeds.  As an active member in his community, Henry also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader and is an active community member.  Henry plans on using future profits from the harvest to invest in a business.  His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he was able to feed his family and send his children to school.
  							
Henry and the Upendo Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo, standing on the left.

loans.use: To obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing both the size of her store and sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products to sell at her store, particularly foods and beverages.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 45 years old and married, and she has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Nilda requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more stock to sell, like soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, detergent, batch soap, etcetera.

Nilda would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like soft drinks, canned goods, and shampoo

loans.name: Muoi

texts.en:
Muoi, 44, is married and has two sons and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income by operating a beauty salon from her house. She started this business 16 years ago.

She requests a loan to expand her business and plans to buy a greater variety of hair care and dye products. These products will help her to better satisfy her customer's needs. She hopes that her business continues to run smoothly and generates a higher income so that she can  improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hair dye and hair care products to sell.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao requests a  loan to buy a range of new products, such as household plastic items, blankets, and bedclothes. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 
She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of household plastic items, blankets, and bedclothes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Labiba

texts.en: Labiba was born in 1980. She is married and has four sons and daughters living with her and her retired husband in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour. She decided to help her husband financially by running her mini-market one year ago. Now she wants to stock her mini-market with a larger quantity of food products in order to raise her sales and profit but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To stock her mini market with food products

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh, 54, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family which includes two daughters and her husband. Her husband is a bricklayer. She earns money by operating  a general store. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of beverages, sugar, milk and fast foods to meet her customers' needs.

She hopes that her business will ensure that her family members, especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy beverages, sugar, milk and fast food to sell at her store.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van is 31 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver for hire. Van has operated a general store (from her home) for 15 years. She started this business to cover her family expenses. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Van requests a loan to expand her business by buying household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes that these products will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase her business. She hopes that she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy household items and soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia was born in 1991. She is a single lady living in a sector of Jordan called Southern Ghour, with her parents and six siblings. Alia has been selling accessories for 2 years. She started her business as a result of the financial problems faced by her family. She began selling a small amount of her products and then she expanded her business. Now, she is planning to buy a larger quantity of accessories by adding variety, in order to raise her profit. She does not have enough money to do this on her own, so she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more accessories to add variety to her supply.

loans.name: Deicy Yisel

texts.es:
Deicy es una campesina pujante y luchadora, nacida en el seno de una familia humilde que encontró en el campo una alternativa de vida y de la cual aprendió a realizar todas las actividades agropecuarias que hoy en día son su principal fuente de ingresos. A sus 27 años de edad, se dedica a la cría y comercialización de pollos y carneros, además tiene gallinas ponedoras cuyos huevos son vendidos en el mercado del municipio donde reside; así genera recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y con el sostenimiento de su hijo de 5 años.
El crédito será invertido en la compra de 100 gallinas ponedoras y 8 carneros, así aumentará la producción y podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus productos, mejorando las ventas y el margen de rentabilidad del negocio. Así podrá avanzar para cumplir su mayor anhelo que es ampliar su galpón y tener una producción de huevos con 1000 gallinas y más carneros, además desea incursionar con la cría y comercialización de pescado para atender otro tipo de mercado, garantizando así una estabilidad económica favorable para dar un mejor nivel educativo a su hijo y disfrutar un futuro más próspero en compañía de los que ama.
texts.en:
Deicy is a hard-working and thriving farmer.  She was born into a poor family in the countryside where they found an alternative lifestyle and that's how she learned about working in agriculture.  Today, she is the main source of the family's income.  She is 27 years old and she raises and sells chickens and sheep.  She also has hens whose eggs are sold in the market in the region in which she lives.  This is how she generates sufficient money to help her husband with burden of the household expenses and how she supports her 5-year-old son.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of 100 hens and 8 sheep.  This will help her increase production and she will be able to meet the demand for her products, increase sales, and improve the profitability margin of her business.  She will be able to make progress in making her biggest dream come true - to expand her warehouse, to increase egg production to 1000 hens, and to sell more meat.  She also wants to dabble in breeding and selling fish so that she can reach another market, which would guarantee a stable economic situation so that she can provide a better education for her son and she can enjoy a prosperous future with the people she loves.

loans.use: to buy 100 hens and 8 sheep.

loans.name: Lateefan

texts.en:
Lateefan is a poor but hardworking woman, age 41, living in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has only a single source of income, which is sheltering services. Her husband provides sheltering services for the construction of roof's and houses. She wants to invest her all savings for the establishment of the business. Sometimes her husband signs two or three contracts for sheltering services at a time, which become the cause of shortage of sheltering material. 
 
Lateefan requested her fifth loan so that her husband can invest more money in the current business. She hopes that through loan amount her husband would be able to buy additional pillars and wooden boards and could get more profit.

loans.use: To buy sheltering material for services.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima lives in a remote region in West Bengal.  She lives in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a 45 -year-old married woman.  She lives with her husband and one daughter, Priyanka. They live in their own small kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo made).  Pratima received an education up to class IV (Grade 4). Pratima could not complete her education due to poverty, but she is willing to provide her daughter with a higher education and desires that her daughter not face any obstacle in receiving her education. Pratima’s daughter Priyanka is now studying in class X (Grade 10) and is very serious about her studies. She aims to become a lawyer in the future.  

Pratima’s husband has been associated with agricultural activities for many years. But his earnings are hardly enough to cover the educational expenses after meeting the household expenses of their family. 

Pratima learned about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan of 15,000 INR for her daughter’s uninterrupted education. With the loan amount, she will pay the tuition fee and buy necessary articles like books, copies, pens, a geometry box etc. for educational purposes for her daughter.
 
Pratima and her daughter Prianka (as per photo) are very grateful to Kiva and BJS for this loan. They give hearty thanks to the lenders.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees and other expenses

loans.name: Huikap Pukhri Mapan Women Weaving Shg Group

texts.en:
Weaving has always been the main activity to generate income for Ibemcha. She has been weaving since before her marriage and continues weaving after her marriage. Her friends commented that she is a good weaver. She joined Huikap Pukhri Mapan SHG with nine other women members and they are all hard working. She is the featured borrower for the group and she is pictured with her hand raised. All the members live in the same neighborhood, which is about 45 kms from the capital.

Ibemcha weaves all kinds of women's wrap arounds and shawls. During the festive season, which falls between October and March, Ibemcha’s weaving business is at peak. Women from neighboring villages, neighbors and women vendors in the market contact her for woven products for weddings, send-off ceremonials and other meitei celebrations. If she could deliver all the demands on time, then she could make a good income, but it is difficult because she weaves alone, and it takes three or four days to complete one women's wrap around skirts. To supply a dozen of them requires a month. The finished products are usually sold to the women vendors who sit in the main Imphal market in the capital town of Manipur, which is about 45 kms from where she lives. She supplies them at wholesale and that way the generated income is beneficial.

With the loan, Ibemcha is planning to buy lots of yarns and threads to weave. This is still the wedding season and she has a number demands from the women who sell her products in the main market. Before she took the loan, she used to get her yarn supplies from the shopkeeper on credit and repay  when the woven products are sold. She is happy that with the loan support she does not ask for credit and she can easily make a spot payment and get the full profit without paying half the share to the shopkeepers. She says thank you to Kiva. 

The rest of the group members are also engaged in weaving and vegetable selling businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more yarn and threads

loans.name: Abrar Alhodeida Group

texts.en: This group is called Abrar Alhodeida. It consists of five ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They have many clients, mostly women. Fatima is 31 years old. She is the coordinator of her group. She is a married woman and has children. She has been selling food for many years. She started selling in her business to assist her husband to cover expenses. Fatima's most important challenges are to work hard to gain extra income and to improve her business structure. She is receiving a loan from AMB to buy food to use for resale. In the future, she would like to expand her business to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food for resale.

loans.name: Kalyani

texts.en:
Kalyani is a hardworking lady from a small village in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district.  She stays with her husband and one child (a son) in a small kachha house (house made of mud and straw). Kalyani and her husband are illiterate, but know to sign their name. She has only one son Jitu, studying in grade 12. Jitu is very studious. Kalyani is very ambitious for her son. She wants to give him a higher education and wants to see him in a good position in society.  As such, she and her husband work as hard as possible so that their son does not face any problems in achieving his education. 

Kalyani’s husband is engaged in agricultural activities. He grows different types of vegetables on their own land and sells them in the local market. Her husband’s income from the business is not sufficient to meet both the educational expenses of their son and the household expenses. She seeks this loan to support her son’s education. 

This loan would help her to pay the tuition fees, to purchase education equipment like books, pens etc. and to pay private tutorial fees for her son’s education. 

Kalyani and her son Jitu (as per photo), are thankful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fees and other educational expenses for her son

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is a housewife from the small village of Dhupguri. She has a daughter, Pratima, studying in class X (grade 10). In spite of being illiterate, she pays more attention to her daughter’s education. Her husband is a carpenter and he supports Minati in educating their child. Minati's daughter Pratima is very serious about her studies. 

Due to a lack of money, Minati was feeling helpless about  managing her child’s educational equipment, tuition fees, school fees etc. She wants the loan from BJS to purchase books, pens, exercise copies etc. and to pay all the tuition fees for her school. It will help her to give private tuition to her child for the subjects she needs.

Now, Minati is quite relaxed about her child’s education as BJS and Kiva came forward to help her financially.
Minati and her daughter Pratima (in the photo) thank BJS and Kiva for this education loan.

loans.use: To pay all the fees related to her daughter’s education.

loans.name: Sabanalamarino Unidos 1 Group

texts.en:
Fior is the leader of Sabanalamarinos Unidos 1, which is a group looking to take out a group loan. They are from the town of Sabana de la Mar, a coastal town in the northern part of the Dominican Republic. This is Fior´s twelfth loan.

Fior has been selling women's underwear for more than seven years. Her many years selling underwear have made it possible for her to find a good market to buy a bigger amount and a very good quality product. She sells in her house, by walking in different communities, and to other sellers. 

Fior and her husband are raising their three children in this coastal town located in the city of Hato Mayor. Her most important challenge now is to provide the best education for her children. 

Fior dreams to have an underwear store and to sell for the wholesale market. Her profits will be dedicated to provide for her family's needs and to save for her children's university. 

Fior and everyone in the Sabanalamarinos Unidos 1 group are excited to receive your help. They can make an increase in their business capital with this loan.

loans.use: to buy underwear for resale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen realiza trabajos por cuenta propia son mantas artesanales de vicuña realisadas con ruecas rusticas desde el hilado hasta el proceso de acabado de la manta cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.
Ella vive en alquiler, ubicada en El Alto en la z/ San Felipe de Seke del Departamento de La Paz a una hora y quince minutos de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz.

el crédito que solicita es para la compra de ladrillo, arena y cemento para construir un muro en el terreno que tiene, pues alcualmente está desprotegido y es muy peligroso dejarlo así, pues hay gente que puede tomar posesión ilegalmente.

El sueño de Carmen es, producir mas mantas de vicuña asi poder llegar a  exportar mantas artesanales de vicuña sin perder la tradicion y cultura Boliviana. Asi poder brindar una buena calidad de servicio al comprador y a su familia.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Carmen makes vicuna wool blankets using rustic distaffs. She does the entire process from spinning to finishing the blankets with her husband's help.  
 
She rents a house in San Felipe de Seke, El Alto, located an hour and 15 minutes from the city of La Paz in La Paz department. She has applied for a loan to buy brick, sand, and cement to build a perimeter wall on her land, which is now unprotected. It is dangerous to leave it that way because someone might take illegal possession of the land.

Carmen's dream is to make more vicuna blankets so that more of these handmade vicuna blankets could be exported without losing the Bolivian tradition and culture. She would be able to offer great service to the buyer and to her family. This is her second loan cycle with IMPRO and her second with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy brick, sand, and cement to build a perimeter wall on her land where she is thinking about building a small house for her family.

loans.name: Josè Amìn

texts.es: Esta es la historia de Josè Amìn, un hombre que fue capaz de descubrir que vivir bien vale la pena y que es mejor caminar por el buen camino. Josè Amìn nació en un pueblo de la costa pacífica, cerca de las selvas tropicales de Colombia y a la orilla de un inmenso rio con un caudal estremecedor. La familia de Josè Amìn, es una familia típica de esta zona del país, conformada por gente luchadora, trabajadora a pesar de las múltiples dificultades económicas.  La tierra chocoana donde nació Josè Amìn es brillante como el oro que sale del interior de las entrañas, es verde como la selva que adorna los paisajes, e inmensa como la majestuosidad de los atardeceres. Josè Amìn hoy está cumpliendo una meta, ESTUDIAR COCINA, porque siente que tiene el talento, la vocación y las ganas de ser mejor persona cada día. Necesitaría el convenio con kiva ya que para el es muy importante seguir con su carrera de cocina y por motivo económico no poderla terminar. Por lo tanto Jose Amin esta solicitando un credito con CampoAlto para estudiar concinar.
texts.en:
This is the story of Jose Amin, a man who was able to discover that living well is worth the effort and it is better to talk on the right path.

Josè Amìn was born in a town on the pacific coast, near the tropic jungles of Colombia and on the banks of an immense and powerful river. Josè Amin's family is a typical family in this part of the country, composed of resilient, hardworking people, despite the many economic difficulties they face. The Chocoana region where Josè Amìn was born is as bright as gold, as green as the jungles that adorn its landscapes and as vast as its majestic sunsets.

Josè Amìn wants to reach his personal goal of studying to cook, because he feels that he has the talent, the vocation and the desire to become a better person every day. He needs support from Kiva, as it is very important that he moves forward with his career, but for economic reasons he has not been able to finish it yet. Therefore he is now applying for a loan with Campo Alto to student cooking.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition to study cooking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 49-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband is a milkman by profession. He sells milk in a shop in the nearby community, and is getting a reasonable income for his family. He has been purchasing milk from the market and selling it as a retailer from his shop. Nowadays, customers are making complaints about the freshness of the milk. This is the reason he wants to buy fresh milk from a wholesaler or from the farms, but their price is higher than market rates. He does not have enough cash in hand to buy fresh milk, but he does not want to compromise quality as well.
Therefore, Khalida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband would be able to purchase fresh milk from the farms to sell.
She hopes that she will be able to make savings through profit amounts. She thanks Kiva and the field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh milk to sell.

loans.name: Ernestina's Group

texts.en:
Ernestina is 38, married and has three dependent children. She is a very brave and enterprising woman and has been able to make the most out of her work as a saleswoman selling cosmetics. 

This is the second loan that Ernestina is applying for. She will invest it in the purchase of the cosmetics her stock for resale. The most important thing for her right now is to overcome the financial crisis she is faced with and establish her business. This loan will be a great way to achieve this. Aside from Ernestina, there are two other group members who will invest this loan in their businesses by buying mineral water and plates.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to increase her stock for resale.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos se dedica a la fabricacion de muebles y partes de muebles, principalmente de madera.
El vive en casa propia, ubicada en El Alto en la z/ Nueva Asuncion del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz

El sueño de Marcos es, comprar un motor (Cortadora) que le es de mucha necesidad para mejorar su  trabajo, puesto que  el que tenia actualmente cumplio con su ciclo de vida util. Asi brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes  y una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Es la primeraa vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Marcos makes furniture and furniture parts, principally out of wood. He lives in his own house, located in El Alto in the Nueva Asunción area in the department of La Paz. It is one hour from the city of La Paz.

Marcos’ dream is to purchase a motor for his wood cutter, which he greatly needs to improve his work, because the one he currently has has completed its life cycle. Thus he will provide better service to his customers and a better quality of life for his family.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time from KIVA.

loans.use: to purchase a motor for his wood cutter and continue with his furniture making business.

loans.name: Orlis

texts.es:
Orlis  tiene 52 años de edad es soltero vive solo en el Cantón  Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Bruniquilde que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Calabi, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agropecuarias.
Orlis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz y maíz también a la crianza de animales como el ganado. Solicita el crédito para la siembra de arroz, maíz y para la compra que es necesaria en la agricultura como la semilla y el abono.   Las compras lo realizan en la ciudad de Ventanas. El sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Los desafíos que se enfrenta es presencia de mucha lluvia. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear en el pueblo y ser responsable en el trabajo.
texts.en:
Orlis is 52 years old, single, and lives in Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Rios.  He is a member of the Bruniquilde solidarity group which is located in the Calabi region of Ventanas Canton. He works in agriculture growing rice and corn and also raising animals such as livestock.  He is asking for the loan so he can plant rice and corn, and for such agricultural necessities as seed and fertilizer. He makes his purchases in Ventanas.

His dream is to improve his living conditions. A challenge that faces him is too much rain.  In his free time he likes to stroll through the village, and he likes to be responsible in his work.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
María, a sus 43 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. 
Se dedica a atender su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que montó hace 5 años, con el ánimo de generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y para pasar más tiempo con sus hijos, el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres que también se dedicaban a esta labor; el negocio está ubicado en el garaje de la casa donde reside y cuenta con la ventaja de ser la única tienda en la cuadra donde vive, por lo que diariamente genera buenas ventas; su horario de atención es de lunes a domingo de 8 am a 11 pm.
Con el ánimo de seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, productos de panadería, carnes frías, gaseosas, lácteos, galletería, y otros productos de la canasta familiar) y cancelar el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente; esto le permitirá tener más variedad de artículos para satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, lo que mejorará notablemente las ventas y los ingresos que recibe.
María tiene como meta a mediano plazo el crecimiento y ampliación de su negocio, que le permita tener mayor rentabilidad y garantizar una estabilidad económica con la que pueda seguir brindando educación a sus hijos y mejorar la calidad de vida de todo el núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old, she is married, and she is the mother of 3 children.  She has gotten by due to a lot of hard work and dedication.  She has run her own small business - which is a small convenience store - for 5 years.  She works so that she can generate income to help her husband with the burden of household expenses and so that she can spend more time with her children.  She learned to do this work from her parents, who also have a small store.  Her business is located in her garage and it has the advantage of being the only store on the block where she lives, and so she generates good daily sales.  She works from Monday to Sunday, from 8 AM to 11 PM.

In order to strengthen her business, she is seeking a loan so that she can buy wholesale items (snacks, baked goods, meats, beverages, dairy products, cookies, and other items like these) and so that she can also pay off the balance of a previous loan.  This will help her to have a bigger variety of products to sell to satisfy her customer's needs, which will notably increase her sales and income.

Maria's medium-term goal is to grow her business, which will enable her to increase profitability and guarantee her economic stability.  She can then continue providing an education for her children and improve the quality of life for her entire family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale goods (snacks, baked goods, meats, beverages, dairy items, cookies, and other items like these) and to pay off the balance of a current loan.

loans.name: Salkyn

texts.ru: Салкын 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 7 детей. Она замечательная мама троих дочерей и четырех сыновей. Старшему из детей 19 лет, младшему 5 лет. Своей гордостью она считает конечно же своих умных, послушных и трудолюбивых детей. У Салкын - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей большой семьи Салкын занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Салкын, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 18 овец. Супруг занимается предоставлением пассажирских услуг. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Салкын обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Салкын планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Salkyn is 41 years old and married. She and her husband are bringing up seven children. She is a wonderful mom to three daughters and four sons. The eldest child is 19 years old, and the youngest is five. Salkyn is proud of her smart, well-behaved and hard-working children. Salkyn has secondary education. As a main source of income for her large family Salkyn raises livestock. She launched this business 20 years ago by buying livestock in the amount of 3,000 KGS. Thanks to Saklyn’s hard work, her farm now includes three dairy cows, one horse and 18 sheep. Salkyn’s husband works as a car service driver. Salkyn’s monthly income is 15,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Salkyn has applied to Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of [missing] to increase her headcount by buying a cow. Salkyn plans to invest the income from her loan into a further increase of livestock. She plans to save up money to pay for her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Zuleyma Arely

texts.es: Zuleyma de 36 años de edad habita  en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza los cuales oferta en las principales zonas de su localidad. Junto a su esposo mantienen la economía de su casa y  les dan a sus hijos el sustento diario. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda ya que la madera y la lámina que actualmente tiene se encuentran en mal estado. Con el crédito comprará lámina galvanizada y madera. Expresa que con lo que percibe de su negocio y los ingresos de su esposo logrará cancelar la deuda que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Zuleyma is 36 years old, and lives in a house that she owns with her husband and their two children.  She woks selling beauty products which she offers throughout the main areas of her community.  Together with her husband, they maintain the finances of their household and provide their children with their daily sustenance.  

With the goal of improving their living conditions, she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in repairing the roof of their house since the wood and the sheet metal that they currently have is in poor condition.  With the loan, she will purchase galvanized sheet metal and wood.  With the earnings from her business and her husbands income, she will be able to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal and wood to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru: Санобар родилась в сельской местности в семье простого крестьянина. С детства она помогала своим родителям по животноводству. Она трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина. Санобар занимается животноводством и растениеводством. Условия жизни у них очень тяжёлые. Ее муж из-за болезни получает пенсию. Сын Санобара, не окончив среднюю школу, уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Санобар кредитуется  в ИМОНе 5-й раз.  Этот займ она попросила  на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения мужа.  Ему нужно сделать операцию. Санобар очень надеется на Вашу финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Sanobar was born in the countryside to a simple peasant family. Since childhood, she has helped her parents raise livestock. She is a hardworking and responsible woman. Sanobar works keeping livestock and farming. Her living conditions are very harsh. Her husband receives a pension due to illness. Sanobar's son did not graduate from high school; instead he went to work in the Russian Federation. Sanobar is taking out a loan with IMON for the fifth time. This time, she is asking for 1,000 TJS to buy drugs for her husband's treatment. He needs surgery. Sanobar has high hopes for your financial support.

loans.use: buy medicine to treat her husband

loans.name: Alaa Edin

texts.en:
Alaa Eldin is an 18-year-old single young man from Jenin City. He lives with his parents in a small house in the city. 

Alaa works in a coffee shop as a worker with a low income. Alaa also studies law at a local university and is in his first year. He loves his specialization. He would like to become a lawyer in the future. 

Alaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Alaa will be able to do his homework and write his reports easily. 

Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Sandra Marisol

texts.es: Las condiciones habitacionales de Sandra y sus tres hijos son muy sencillas y humildes. Habita en casa propia y es madre soltera.  Sandra hace todo lo que este a su alcance para dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones a las que ella ha tenido acceso.  Su principal fuente de ingresos es la venta de pescado de agua salada que realiza de forma ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad.  Su vivienda es muy humilde construida a base de madera y plástico la cual desea repara con el fin de dar mayor seguridad  a sus hijos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para dar inicio a la reparación del techo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Sandra and her three children live under very poor housing conditions. She is a single mother and owns her house. She does all within her reach to provide her children with better living conditions than those she had access to. Her principal source of income is from her sale of salt water fish as a street vendor in the major areas of her community.

Sandra’s home is very modest and built from wood and plastic. She wants to repair it with the goal of providing her children with greater security. To do so, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to purchase galvanized sheets and wood so she can start repairing her roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets and wood to repair the roof on her dwelling.

loans.name: Vagan

texts.en: Vagan is from the village Shulaveri, Marneuli district. He is 29 years old and lives with his parents, grandmother, wife and little child. With the help of the family members, Vagan is engaged in agribusiness, which is the most important source of the family's income. He has been involved in cultivation of potatoes and then sells them in the local market. Vagan also works at the laundry and generates approximately 300 GEL monthly.  However, the family belongs to socially vulnerable categories.  As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, he wants to start a trading business in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of his family. A loan of 1,500 GEL will be a great support to this hardworking man, enabling him to purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and then selling them at a good price. Vagan and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: to start a trading business selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Leonilita

texts.en:
Leonilita, who works hard to support her family, has had an abaca weaving business in the Philippines for 30 years. She has  requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her enterprise.

In the future, Leonilita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther does farming in Kangundo town where she plants cash crops such as maize, beans and vegetables to sell. She is 59 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with seven children. Her spouse also provides additional income. 

She plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting on her farm. This will enable her to harvest more produce and get more income. She will use part of the generated profits to repay the loan and also save some of it.  This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. In the future she hopes to construct a house for her family and install electricity power as well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Melab

texts.en:
Melab has a beauty salon business in Kitengela town. She is 35 years old, single, and has one child. She has been in this business for two years, and right now her monthly income is KES 25,000.  She will use this loan to buy more beauty products and salon equipment for use in her business. These include blow dryers, hair oil, lotions and cosmetics. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her child, as well as repay the loan. 

This is her fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her salon business and even employ more workers.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment and beauty products.

loans.name: Wa`ad Group

texts.en:
Wa`ad is a group of five women from Hodeidah, Yemen who have requested a loan of 110,000  (YER) to be used for running their businesses well. Jabra, a 42-year-old married mother who lives in Hodeidah, Yemen, has been working in embroidery for eight years. She started her business as a hobby in her home where she embroidered at her leisure. 

Jabra strives as much as possible to expand her business so that she can improve the living conditions of her family. She will use her loan portion of 20,000 YER from AMB to buy embroidery materials such as needles, thread and fabrics for her business. 

Jabra looks forward to making profits in order to enroll her children in private schools so they can receive a good education.

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials such as needles, thread and fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is 33 years old, and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has to work hard to feed her family. She is the mother of two sons and three daughters. To cover her household expenses she runs a small tailoring business at home with the help of her sister who has been learning tailoring along with her and has gotten a lot of experience. Riffat wants to buy a new sewing machine for her sister so that she can contribute to their income by sewing clothes.

Therefore, Riffat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she can buy new sewing machine for her sister. Riffat wants to thank Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Diana Consuelo

texts.es:
Diana Consuelo, es una joven creativa, divertida, amigable, inteligente, apasionada, responsable, humana, honesta y comprometida en todos los campos de la vida. Es muy dedicada a los estudios por que  considera el estudio muy importante para el desarrollo integral y  adquirir competencias que le permitan servir a la sociedad.
Nació en Bogotá. De  familia humilde con  gran  prioridad para ella; está conformada por los padres, una hermana melliza y un hermano mayor, ella  ama mucho y su familia y se siente orgullosa. 

Actualmente estudia en La Corporación de Educación Superior Las Mercedes, en el programa Técnico Profesional en Contabilidad Financiera y pasa a quinto Semestre. Ha obtenido un buen promedio en las notas, lo cual la tiene muy satisfecha ya que significa un gran logro en la vida poderse graduar y vincular laboral mente en este campo. Aunque ha pasado por varias dificultades para lograr el sueño, ella quiere superarse y al terminar la carrera, quiere profesionalizarse.   


También ha pasado por dificultad económica la cual ha sabido llevar con mucha paciencia, manteniendo una actitud perseverante y positiva, en unidad familiar y sacando de cada problema una enseñanza provechosa para la vida.  El convenio Kiva es de gran importancia para poder continuar con el estudio, ya que constituye un apoyo económico fundamental para cumplir el sueño de graduarse.   

El sueño de diana consuelo a largo plazo es  ser profesional, trabajar y realizarse como persona teniendo, si Dios se lo concede, una linda familia.
texts.en:
Diana Consuelo is a creative, fun, friendly, intelligent, passionate, responsible, human, honest, and committed young woman in all fields of live.  She's a very dedicated student because she thinks studying and acquiring skills to serve society are important to her complete development.

Diana Consuelo was born in Bogotá into a modest family with high hopes for her.  Her family consists of her parents, her twin sister, and an older brother.  She loves her family very much and is proud of them.

Currently she's studying to be an accountant at the Corporación de Educación Superior Las Mercedes.  She's just starting her fifth semester and she has maintained a good average in her grades, which is satisfying to her because being able to graduate and get a job in this field represents a great achievement in her life.  She has gone through some adversity to achieve her dream, but she wants to excel, finish school, and become a professional.

Diana Consuelo has also gone through financial difficulties and has learned to be patient, persevering, and positive with her family, taking each problem as a useful life lesson.  The agreement with Kiva is very important to her for being able to continue with her studies because the financial support is fundamental to achieving her dream of graduating.

Diana Consuelo's long-term dream is to be a professional, work, and have a beautiful family, if God grants her that.

loans.use: to pay her tuition for the semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, coal, and oil for her business,

loans.name: Jumakan

texts.ru: Жумакан 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Жумакан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жумакан занимается покупкой-и перепродажей скота, предварительно откормив скот, реализует по более высокой цене. Супруг активно помогает ей в этом. В ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жумакан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Жумакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также намерена сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Jumakan is 30 years old, married, and raising three children with her husband. Jumakan has a secondary education. Her family's primary source of income is Jumakan's work buying, fattening, and reselling cattle. Her husband actively helps her. Today, her farm boasts two dairy cows and fifteen sheep. Her monthly income is 9,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Jumakan approached the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy cattle to fatten and then resell for a profit. Jumakan plans to use profits she makes from the loan to increase her livestock and repair her home.

loans.use: buy cows to fatten and sell

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru:
Анвару 37 лет. Он живет в одном из сел района Шахритус. Он женат. Анвар решил начать новую деятельность животноводство и дополнительно растениеводством. Растениеводством он будет заниматься для своей семьи, чтобы они питались здоровой пищей. Его основная деятельность будет животноводством. Анвар начитанный мужчина и у него имеется не большой опыт в этой сфере деятельности и бизнес план. Он собирается покупать бычков из скотного рынка "Искра". Анвар будет кормить и содержать скотов в коровнике. У него имеется все условия для начала такого бизнеса, в том числе сено, жмых и другой корм. 
  На данный момент у Анвара уже есть 3 коровы и 10 голов баранов, они использовались для семейных нужд. Анвар берет кредит для покупки скотов и увеличения голов скота. Он купит несколько голов бычков, и добавить в их число имеющийся скотов и начнет свой бизнес. Такими планами он обратился за кредитом. Он надеется, что Вы ему поможете, и он реализует свои планы.
texts.en:
Anvar is 37 years old. He lives in one of the villages in Shahrituz. He is married. Anvar has decided to start a new business raising livestock and farming. He will do this for his family, so that they can eat healthy food. His primary occupation is raising livestock. Anvar is a well-read man who has a little experience in this business.  He's going to buy calves from cattle market called Iskra. Anvar will feed and keep his cattle in the barn. He has everything he needs to start this business, including hay, sunflower seed cake and other food. 

Presently, Anvar has three cows and ten sheep which are kept for the family's use. Anvar is taking out a loan to buy cattle and increase his livestock. He is buying a few calves, and adding them to the cattle he already has to start his business. He applied for a loan with this plan. He hopes that you'll help him, and that he will be able to fulfill his plans.

loans.use: start a new business buying and selling cattle.

loans.name: Julina

texts.en:
Julina is 63 years old, married and has eight children, one of whom is still in school.

Julina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Julina has been in pig fattening for one year now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Julina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tomasa Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Tomasa tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos siendo el mayor de 18 años, quienes van a la escuela y en tiempos libres apoyan en el negocio a su madre que es una pequeña pulpería, doña Tomasa cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien labora en  ganadería y con los ingresos apoya a su familia. Solicita este crédito para invertir en su negocio aumentando el número de productos que más vende como granos básicos, jugos refrescos gaseosas, plásticos, esto con el objetivo de surtir su negocio para garantizar sus ingresos diarios que mucha falta hace.
texts.en: Tomasa, who is 40 years old, is the mother of  3 children. The oldest is 18 years old. They all go to school and in their spare time support their mother's grocery business. Tomasa also has the support of her husband who works in livestock farming and helps support his family with the income. She's soliciting this loan to invest in her business. She'll stock up on the products she sells most, like basic grains, juice, refreshments, soda and plastic in order to guarantee her much needed daily income.

loans.use: Buy basic grains, juice, refreshments, soda and plastic.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is a married woman and a mother of two young children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than seven years now.

Ronalyn is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Ronalyn hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional goods for resale in the food market.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 34-year-old lady living with her spouse, two daughters and three sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is a responsible mother; her two children are too young and fully dependent upon their parents. She belongs to a poor family, and she has to feed her huge family on a low income.

Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years, and his income is insufficient to feed his whole family. He has to maintain the auto rickshaw body, but he does not have a sufficient amount to fix the problem. Therefore, Riffat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy a new body for his rickshaw. 

Riffat hopes that she will be able to make enough savings until her children are grown and that she will succeed in providing higher education to her children.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina se dedica a la venta de pollos, embutidos y carnes en su frial, brinda el servicio de que el alimento que proporcione sea fresco y de gran calidad. 

Ella vive en casa propia ubicada en  Viacha Z/ Villa Mercedes del Departamento de La Paz, aproximadamente a una hora de viaje desde la ciudad de La Paz.

El sueño de Paulina es crecer y a mediano plazo, contar con su propia granja de pollos la cual sea de gran ayuda para ella,llegar a darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Así, está solicitando un crédito para aumentar su capital y poder comprar más pollo, carne y embutidos y surtir su frial con más porductos.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Paulina sells chicken, cold cuts and meat at her deli. She provides a service by delivering fresh, high-quality foodstuffs.

She lives in a house that she owns. It is located in the Villa Mercedes area of the town of Viacha, department of La Paz, approximately a one-hour drive from the city of La Paz.

Paulina's dream is to grow, and in time, own her own chicken farm. This will be of great help for her to eventually improve her family's living conditions. Thus, she's requesting a loan so that she can increase her capital and purchase more chicken, meat and cold cuts in order to stock her deli with more merchandise.

This is her first loan with IMPRO and also her first loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of chicken, meat and cold cuts for her deli.

loans.name: Santa Marilu

texts.es:
Santa tiene 41 años de edad es soltera vive con sus cinco hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 
Es integrante de la ventanilla Bruniquilde que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Calabi, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agropecuarias.
Santa se dedica a la siembra de maíz y crianza de gallinas. Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno y no perder los terrenos para los cultivos. Las compras realiza en el comercial Montenegro en Ventanas. Su sueño es mejorar la producción de los cultivos. El desafío que enfrenta es las malezas. En su tiempo libre le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Santa is 41 years old, single and lives with her five children in the Ventanas canton of the Los Ríos province in Ecuador.

Santa is a member of the Bruniquilde communal ban, located in the Calabi area, which is part of the Ventanas canton. Santa makes a living in agricultural work.

Santa working growing corn and raising hens. She is applying for this loan in order to rent land and not lose land where she grows her crops. Santa makes her purchases in Montenegro, in Ventanas. Her dream is to improve her crop production. A challenge that Santa is facing is dealing with weeds. Santa likes to spend her free time with her family.

loans.use: to sow corn.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 38 years old and married. She has five children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for four years, and she earns additional income by raising livestock.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to sell, including vinegar, fabric conditioner, laundry soap, noodles, eggs, and bread. Arlene has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF, before this loan.

Arlene aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, including vinegar, laundry soap, and noodles

loans.name: Erika Cristina

texts.es:
Erika es una joven emprendedora y dinámica, nació en el seno de una familia campesina que encontró en las labores agropecuarias una alternativa para ganarse la vida, actividad que aprendió desde que era niña, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. Hoy en día, a sus 22 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como empleada de medio tiempo en un cultivo de flores y, de manera independiente alterna su empleo con la ganadería, pues posee vacas productoras de leche y ganado de levante, la producción del líquido se la vende a un hermano que posee un carro recolector, generando así ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y para dar sustento a su hijo de 4 años.
El crédito lo solicita como un apoyo de inversión para su negocio, con el dinero comprará más ganado de levante y vacas productoras de leche, además cancelará el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente. Esto le permitirá aumentar su producción y satisfacer la demanda actual, generando mayores ingresos por ventas.
Erika manifiesta que su proyecto para un futuro cercano es continuar creciendo su negocio, adquirir más ganado y así aprovechar los pastos que tiene disponibles, lo que generará mayor rentabilidad, mejores ingresos y la posibilidad de ofrecer a su hija una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Erika is an enterprising and dynamic young woman. She was born into a peasant family who found agriculture and cattle raising work to be a good way to earn a living. Thanks to her parents, Erika has been learning this trade since she was a little girl. Now, at 22 years old, Erika makes a living working part-time on a flower farm and she also independently raises cattle. She has dairy cows and raises cattle. She sells her milk to one of her brothers, who has a truck. With this work, Erika earns an income to help her husband with household costs and to support their four children.

Erika is applying for a loan to invest in her business. She will use the money to buy cattle to raise and to buy dairy cows. In addition, she will use some of the loan to pay off another loan. This will allow Erika to increase production and satisfy demand, thus increasing her income from sales.

Erika tells us that her plans for the near future are to continue expanding her business, buying more cattle and taking advantage of the pastures that she has. This will make her business more profitable, and give her a better income and the opportunity to offer her daughter a quality education.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to raise and diary cows; she will also pay off another loan.

loans.name: Mokhidil

texts.ru: Мохидил 37 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 сына. У Мохидил - среднее образование, она домохозяйка, ведет домашнее хозяйство и воспитывает сына. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мохидил занимается животноводством, стартовав 6 лет назад, с покупки скота на 25,000 сом KGS. Супруг помогает ей по хозяйству. У Мохидил  болшой опыт в разведении скота, все условия для содержания скота имеются. Сено и корма Мохидил заготавливает сама, частично закупает. Благодаря упорному труду Мохидил, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 2 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мохидил обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Мохидил планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также Мохидил намерена сделать ремонт дома, в котором она проживает вместе со своей семьей.
texts.en: Mokhidil is 37 years old, married, and raising one son with her husband. Mokhidil has a secondary education. She is a housewife, cares for the farm, and is raising a son. Mokhidil's work in animal husbandry is the main source of income for the family. She started this six years ago when she bought 25,000 KGS worth of livestock. Her husband helps her on the farm. Mokhidil has vast experience breeding cattle, and she has everything she needs to keep cattle. Mokhidil harvests the hay and feed herself.  Because of Mokhidil's hard work, her farm now boasts four milk cows and two sheep. She earns a monthly income of 9,500 KGS. In order to further expand her farm, Mokhidil has approached the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy cattle to fatten and resell for a profit. Mokhidil plans to invest profits she makes from the loan in increasing her livestock and repairing her family home.

loans.use: buy cows to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 45 years old and runs a photo studio in Kangundo town. He has been in this business for three years now and it has been profitable. He is married, and together with his spouse, they have been blessed with two children. Besides the photo studio business, he also has a mobile money transfer (M-Pesa) business.

He plans to use this loan amount to buy more photo studio items such as picture frames and photo albums. He will also use part of it to start a bookshop business. He will use the anticipated profits to open another photo studio.  This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to have more businesses and also to educate his children so they can have a good future.

loans.use: To buy more photo studio equipment.

loans.name: Bazargul

texts.ru: Базаргул, 41 год, вдова, имеет 8 детей. Супруг умер в феврале 2013 года, и Базаргул осталась одна со своими детьми. После смерти мужа, кормильца семьи в поиске доходов для своей семьи Базаргул стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Бизнес начала с 2,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Базаргул достигла небольших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Базаргул имеется: 2 овцы и земельный надел 0,60 ГА, на котором она ежегодно выращивает хлопок. По хозяйству помогают все дети, понимая трудность ситуации и материального положения, дети со всем усердием пытаются помочь своей маме по хозяйству. Двое старших детей находятся в России, на заработках. Помогают материально, высылая ежемесячно свою зарплату семье в Кыргызстан. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Базаргул обратилась в «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку семян хлопка, а также удобрений и ядохимикатов. Доходы от кредита Базаргул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего небольшого хозяйства, а также в будущем планирует построить новый дом.
texts.en: Bazargul is 41 years old, a widow, and has 8 children. Her husband died in February 2013, and Bazargul was left alone with their children. After her husband's death, Bazargul became involved in farming and livestock in order to find a source of income for the family. She started her business with 2,000 KGS. Thanks to her extremely hard work, Bazargul has had some small successes developing her farm, and she began to earn a monthly income of 8,000 KGS. Currently, Bazargul's farm has two sheep and a 0.60 hectares plot where she grows cotton. All of the children help on the farm. They understand their mother's difficult situation and financial problems. The children diligently try to help their mother with the work. The two older children are working in Russia. They help financially by sending their salary every month to the family in Kyrgyzstan. In order to further develop her farm, Bazargul approached Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to purchase cotton seed, fertilizer, and pesticide. Bazargul plans to invest profit she makes from the loan into further developing her small farm and eventually building a new house.

loans.use: buy cotton seed, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, magi cubes, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Francisco Israel

texts.es:
Francisco de 70 años de edad, es un  hombre trabajador, ha sido albañil, pero a su edad se le dificulta mucho desempeñar este oficio. Logro estudiar hasta 6° grado de educación básica y posteriormente se dedicó a aprender sobre albañilería., está casado y su esposa, además, de realizar los quehaceres del hogar, le ayuda en el cuido de un par de vaquitas que tienen , sus dos hijas ya establecieron  su propio hogar y ya no viven con ellos.


Al no poder ya desempeñar el oficio de albañilería, don Francisco se dedica a desarrollar cultivos de maíz, frijol y sorgo. También tiene tres vacas lecheras, de las cuales obtiene la leche que la comercializa a $0.40 la botella y estas vacas producen 25 botellas entre las tres. Tiene ya un acuerdo con la persona que se la compra y  por ello tiene que ir cumpliendo con la producción. Los cultivos y las vacas, están a ½ km. de su casa. Estos requieren de cuido y manejo todos los días.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es,  para comprar una vaca lechera, ya que tiene un acuerdo con la persona que le compra la leche y tiene que cubrir con la cantidad de botellas pactadas; en esta época seca,  baja la producción de leche por no haber mucho alimento para los animales, por ello ha pensado en adquirir otra vaca que le pueda ayudar a mantener la producción normal. Así don Francisco,  podrá mantener satisfecho a su cliente y así garantizar ese ingreso que le genera esa actividad.

Su sueño es,  poder tener una pequeña granja, donde hallan gallinas, cerdos, cabras, vacas, caballos, entre otros animales, teniendo lo necesario para vivir tranquilamente con su esposa.
texts.en:
Francisco is 70 years old and a hard-working man. He previously worked as a builder but, given his age, it became difficult to carry out this work. Francisco completed up to sixth grade at school and then went into the building trade. He is married: his wife does the household chores and helps look after the cows that they have. The couple's two daughters now have their own homes.

Unable to work in construction any longer, Francisco starting growing corn, beans and sorghum. He also has three dairy cows, the milk from which he sells at $0.40 per litre. The three cows produce 25 bottles between them. Francisco has a deal with the person who buys the milk and so he continues with production. The cows and crops are 500 metres from Francisco's house and they require looking after every day.

Francisco is applying for a loan to buy a dairy cow as he already has a deal with someone who buys the milk and Francisco must provide the agreed number of bottles. During this dry season milk production decreases due to a lack of feed for the animals. As a result, Francisco has decided to buy another cow which can help him to maintain normal levels of production. That way Francisco can keep his customer satisfied and guarantee an income from this work.

Francisco's dream is to have a small farm to breed hens, pigs, goats, cows, horses and other animals and have everything he needs to live a quiet life with his wife.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dúo Las Iluciones Group

texts.es:
DUO LAS ILUSIONES
La señora Sebastiana de 36 años, soltera,  desde hace 3 años posee una Tortillería ubicada en la Aldea los Planes Zona 2, Col San Rafael, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de doña Sebastiana es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a KIVA; con el préstamo quiere comprar Maíz para seguir creciendo con su tortillería.
texts.en: "DUO LAS ILUSIONES" group. Sebastiana is 36 years old and single. For the past 3 years she has had a tortilla shop located in Aldea los Planes, Zona 2 Col. San Rafael. From her efforts she has been able to establish and improve her house. Through her business she has maintained and gotten her family ahead. Sebastiana's dream is to be able to improve the quality of living for her and her family With the loan she is asking from Kiva.she wants to buy corn to continue expanding her tortilla shop.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Fredrick's Group

texts.en:
Amani is a group of three group leader farmers in Chwele District with Fredrick selected as the Kiva representative of the group.  Fredrick has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 32 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Fredrick is a reliable member of the community.  He is married and has nine children.  Fredrick is 46 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 24 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Fredrick is very active in his community and is involved in the savings group.  He described his harvest last year as excellent.  He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue enjoying the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							

Fredrick joined One Acre Fund in 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Fredrick joined One Acre Fund so that he could get new farming methods.  Because he is an active community member, Fredrick has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Fredrick's life because he has more profits from harvest.  In the future, Fredrick hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school.  							

Fredrick and the Amani Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a thirty-five year-old farmer who is married and has three children living in Bundibugyo- Uganda. She has a cocoa garden where she harvests cocoa for selling.  Apart from that, she sells cassava flour and rice to her customers who live around town. She wants to expand the business but has been challenged by seasonal changes and thieves. 
Mwajuma is asking for a loan to buy cassava flour, rice and cocoa to sell.

loans.use: To buy cassava flour, rice and cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Abdukahor

texts.ru: Абдукахор житель района Фархор. Ему 48 лет. Абдукахор счастливый отец двоих детей. Он воспитывает двоих сыновей. Им по 6 и 3 года. Абдукахор занимается растениеводством. На своем земельном участке (3гектара) выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Семейные расходы покрываются за счет деятельности земледелия. Дети растут и растут их потребности, поэтому Абдукахор решил параллельно начать бизнес животноводства. Он составил свой бизнес план и после получения кредита он всерьез возьмется за работу. Абдукахор хочет на сумму от кредита купить 3-4 скота и после длительного откорма перепродать с наценкой. Он надеется, что мир не без добрых людей и ему помогут начать бизнес.
texts.en: Abdukahor is a resident of the Farkhor district.  He is 48 years old. Abdukahor is a happy father of two children.  He is raising two sons, who are 6 and 3 years old.  Abdukahor is involved in agriculture.  He grows agricultural crops on his land plot (3 hectares).  Family expenses are covered by the agricultural business income.
