The children are growing and so are their needs, and this is why Abdukahor decided to also start an animal husbandry business.  He put together his business plan and will seriously start the work after obtaining this loan.  Abdukahor wants to use this loan to buy 3-4 heads of livestock and resell them with a markup after a long period of fattening up.  He hopes that the world is not without kind people, who can help him to start this business.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start his animal husbandry business

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a farmer living in Kisii, the land known for good banana production. She is married and has four children; those who are old enough go to school.

Prisca has been farming for the past fourteen years, producing and selling milk, eggs, and tea. She enjoys farming a lot, and it is her main source of income. Poor roads and sometimes a lack of markets for her products are her major farming challenges.

Prisca chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because it meets clients' financial needs and grant their loans at customer-friendly interest rates. With this loan she will buy another dairy cow, which will result in more milk production. In this way her income will improve, and she will be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: José Marío

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 36 años de edad, trabajador y responsable que junto a su pareja de vida a podido darles el sustento a sus cuatro hijos, a pesar de solo haber cursado tercer grado de educación, eso no ha sido obstáculo para luchar por su  familia. Su señora se dedica a la venta de frutas en el punto de micro buses, en esta actividad le ayudan sus dos hijas mayores, estas en la mañana estudian y en la tarde se dedican apoyarla.

José trabaja en una ferretería desde hace tres años, cuando hay que trasladar materiales a cantones  del  municipio, él es el motorista que realiza la actividad, cuando no hay que movilizar material hace otros oficios, como inventario de materiales existentes en la ferretería, ordenar en la bodega, entre otras tareas. Trabaja de lunes a domingo, en horarios de  7:00 am a 5:00pm de la tarde.

José necesita el crédito,  para reparar su vivienda, comprar costaneras, teja, clavos, cemento y arena, así podrá tener una vivienda segura y con condiciones dignas, que su familia se sienta segura y cómoda. Quiere aprovechar la época seca, que no hay lluvias para realizar los trabajos de reparación, pero no cuenta con los suficientes recursos, por lo cual decidió solicitar el préstamo  y manifiesta que junto con su esposa trabajaran duro para cubrir con la responsabilidad  que se están comprometiendo ( crédito) 

Desea que sus hijos tengan un hogar digno, que se sientan seguros, que no les falte nada y que se puedan preparar en la parte académica y sean unos profesionales de bien y capaces de sostenerse económicamente.
texts.en:
Jose is a 36 year old man, hardworking, and responsible. Along with his wife, he has been able to provide for their four children in spite of only having completed a third grade education. That has not been an obstacle when working hard for his family. His wife makes a living selling fruit at the bus station. She is helped by her two oldest daughters, who study in the morning and in the afternoon help their mother.

Jose has been working in a hardware store for the last three years. When it is necessary to move materials to districts in the town, he is the driver that carries out the job. When it is not necessary to move materials, he has other responsibilities, such as taking inventory of existing items in the hardware store and organizing the warehouse, among other tasks. He works Monday through Sunday from 7:00am to 5:00pm in the afternoon.

Jose needs the loan to repair his home and purchase rafters, tiles, nails, cement, and sand. This way he will be able to have a secure home with respectable conditions that will make his family feel safe and comfortable. He wants to take advantage of the dry season when there is no rain to make the repairs, but he does not have sufficient resources. That is why he decided to request the loan, declaring that along with his wife they will work hard to cover the responsibility of the commitment (the loan).

He wants his children to have a respectable home, feel safe, not lack anything, and be able to prepare academically and become good professionals capable of sustaining themselves financially.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair his home, including rafters, tiles, nails cement, and sand.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is from Kapan town, where she lives with her husband. Anush's husband works in the army and Anush herself has been involved in a retail business. She has been selling clothing for four years already. The income that she gathers helps her husband to sustain the family's living. Due to Anush's kind and good attitude toward her clients, people prefer to purchase clothing from her. 

Now, by asking for this loan, Anush would like to purchase a new stock of clothing in order to be able to cover current demand. 

Anush has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a huge support, helping this hard-working woman to continue her business and gather more income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru:
Бахтиёр 31 летний отец двоих детей, верный муж и любящий сын. У него большая семья, состоящая из его родителей, жены и двоих детей. Бахтиёр со своей семьей живет в городе Душанбе. У Бахтиёра трех летний водительский стаж. Таким преимуществом он решил начать новую деятельность. Бахтиёр собирается купить мини-автобус Starex и возить людей из одной точки города до другой. Бахтиёру нравиться водить машину, и он хочет совместить приятное с полезным. Услуга маршрутки прибыльная работа и для Бахтиёра такая работа станет любимым, потому что он хочет служить жителем и гостям столицы, чтобы они не чувствовали дискомфорт с транспортом. 
  К сожалению мини-автобус стоит дорого для ее приобретения у Бахтиёра не хватает часть денег. Он просит кредит, чтобы купить мини автобус, начать свою деятельность, начать зарабатывать и обеспечивать семью.
texts.en:
Bakhtiyor is 31 years old, the father of two children, a faithful husband and loving son. He has a large family, which consists of his parents, wife and two children. Bakhtiyor lives in the city of Dushanbe, together with his family. 

Bakhtiyor has three years of experience as a driver. He decided that it would be an advantage to start a business. Bakhtiyor decided to purchase a mini-bus of the type "Starex", and drive people from one place to another. Bakhtiyor enjoys driving, and he would like to combine business with pleasure. The "marshrutka" service is profitable, and Bakhtiyor likes this work. Therefore he would like to serve the capital's residents and visitors, so they don't feel discomfort during the transport. 

Unfortunately the mini-bus is expensive, and Bakhtiyor does not have enough own money to purchase it. He requests a loan in order to purchase the mini-bus, start his own business and start earning money to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus of the type "Starex"

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: A sus 60 años de edad Ana trabaja muy duro para mantener a sus hijos los cuales habitan junto a ella y dependen de los cuidados especiales de ella y de su esposo ya que dos de los tres hijos que tiene no se pueden valer por sí mismos. Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos y además con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado adecuar una pequeña tienda en su hogar de residencia de esta forma logra llevar el sustento a su hogar y unir ingresos para mantener a sus hijos. Con el fin de dar mayor seguridad  y comodidad a su familia desea levantar las paredes del corredor que hace un tiempo comenzó y no logró terminar. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro para construir las paredes lo antes posible.
texts.en:
At 60-years-old Ana works very hard to care for her children who live at home with her and depend on her and her husband's special care because two of their three children are not able to care for themselves. She makes a living raising and selling pigs and with a lot of effort, has also been able to run a small store from her home. In this way, she is able to sustain her household and bring together her earnings to care for her children. 

With the purpose of offering greater security and comfort for her family, Ana would like to finish the walls of her entryway. She begun this project a while ago but was unable to finish. For this reason she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, gravel and iron so that her walls are built as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, gravel and iron to build walls along the entryway of her home.

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.ru: Мунаввар трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1958 году. Всё свою жизнь она проработала для благо своей семьи. Последнее 2 года, она занимается производством и продажей мука производственных изделий как булочка, пирог и т.п. Мунаввар торгует на местном рынке. Ее дочь помогает ей введению бизнеса. Мунаввар хочет расширить оборотный капитал и таким образом привлечь больше клиентов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки муки, сахара и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Munavvar is a hardworking woman.  She was born in 1958.  She spent her whole life working for the welfare of her family.  She has been involved in making and selling baked goods, such as buns, pies and the like, for the last two years.  Munavvar sells these goods at a local market.  Her daughter helps her with running the business.  Munavvar wants to increase her working capital and, thus, attract more customers.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni to purchase flour, sugar, etc.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar to increase her working capital

loans.name: Fallé

texts.fr:
Mlle Fallé, est une jeune coiffeuse qui exerce le métier depuis 2008. Elle a ouvert un salon de coiffure et a une clientèle régulière. Elle a remarqué que pour tresser, le client ramenait tout ce dont elle aura besoin de l’extérieur, elle donc pensé à une solution plus optimale et plus rentable pour elle : chercher des produits cométiques et vendre sur place. Pour cela, elle a besoin d’un financement pour acheter des mèches, du greffage, des poudres, du vernis à ongle, des boites de fard…
Célibataire sans enfant, elle habite chez ses parents et donne une participation volontaire pour la dépense quotidienne. Pour le bénéfice, elle le réinvesti dans l’activité pour améliorer toujours le salon et être à la mode par rapport au monde extérieur.
texts.en:
Ms. Fallé is a young hairdresser who has been working in this sector since 2008. She opened a hair salon and built a steady clientele. 

Having noticed that customers who wanted braids had to bring all necessary supplies to her from the outside, she decided that it would make better business sense for her to stock and sell cosmetic products in her store. To that end, she is seeking a loan to buy hair extensions, weaves, powders, nail polish, blush, etc. 

She is a single woman without children who lives with her parents and who voluntarily helps with the day-to-day expenses. 

She reinvests her profits in her activity to continue to improve her salon and to keep it trendy.

loans.use: to by hair extensions, weaves, and cosmetic products to sell in her hair salon.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marcelina is 48 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Marcelina has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Marcelina requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her weaving business.

Marcelina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда добрая женщина. Ей 42 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Двое ее детей совершеннолетние, а двое не совершеннолетние. Мавчуда уже более 20 лет занимается виноградарством. Она имеет плантацию, где она выращивает виноградник. Мавчуда очень хорошо знает все тонкости своего дела. Ее супруг помогает ей введению бизнеса. Ее муж тоже имеет свой бизнес скотоводством. Мавчуда должна провести свадьбу своего сына, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mavjuda is a kind woman.  She is 42 years old.  She is married and raising 4 children.  Two of her children are of age, and two still are not.  Mavjuda has been involved in a grape vine growing business for over 20 years.  She has a plantation, where she grows grape vines.  Mavjuda knows all of the nuances of her business well.  Her husband helps to run the business.  Her husband also has his own business - animal husbandry.  Mavjuda has to hold a wedding for her son, but does not have money.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni to hold a wedding party for her son.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to hold a wedding party for her son

loans.name: Shehzad

texts.en:
Shehzad is a 33-year-old man living with his three children in Lahore, Pakistan.

He successfully runs a small café in a nearby town where he offers cold drinks, chips, spicy food items, and sandwiches. Usually his clients are workers and laborers from the construction companies in his town. Every morning he goes to the market to buy food products for his employees to prepare meals to sell. 

Shehzad’s café is open from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. Nowadays, the population of laborers has increased and the demand for food items as well. He does not feel calm due to the rush in front of his café and the lack manageable seating arrangements.

Therefore, Shehazad has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan (a field partner of Kiva) to buy more spicy foods and plastic furniture for sitting in his café.

Shehzad thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fast food itmes and plastic furniture for his café

loans.name: Nyam-Osor

texts.en:
Mr. Nyam-osor, 25 years old, lives with his father, mother and brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He has been working as a welder since 2011. His brother studies at university.

He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy a computer for educational purposes. His brother has lots of home assignments for which he needs a computer and the internet. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who doesn't want his brother to be like him, a blue collar worker.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
Gurgen has been providing taxi service for three years using his own car. He lives in Gyumri town with his wife and 13-year-old son. Gurgen is the only breadwinner of the family and he feels responsible to gather good income and sustain his family's living. Gurgen is asking for this loan to purchase new tires and to renovate the car. It is very important for him, as the car is damaged and Gurgen is unable to use it.   

Gurgen has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.  The loan will be a huge support for Gurgen and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for new tires and to renovate his car.

loans.name: Amrullo

texts.ru: Амрулло добросовестный, целеустремлённый и трудолюбивый человек. Он родился в сельской местности, который имеет хорошее условие для животноводства и выращивания сельскохозяйственных культур. Семья Амрулло был  малообеспеченным и он с детства помогал родителям по скотоводству и выращивания сельхоз культур. После окончания средней школы Амрулло женился,  и жена помогала ему по животноводству и выращиванию сельхоз культур. В основном они занимались скотоводством, то есть из базара покупали скот по низкой цене, на определённое время откармливали  и перепродали по высокой цене. Из-за неблагополучной погоды и климата их бизнес не дал положительных результатов, поэтому старший и младший  сын уехали на  заработки в Федерацию России. Амрулло необходимо отремонтировать дом и готовиться свадьбу сына. Поэтому он обращался  в ИМОН с целью получения займа для покупки строительных материалов.  Амрулло очень надеется на Вашу благотворительность и милосердие.
texts.en:
Amrullo is a conscientious, purposeful and hard-working man. He was born in a village which has good conditions for livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. Amrullo's family had a low income and since childhood he helped his parents with farming. 

After finishing high school, Amrullo got married, and his wife helped him with the livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. They mainly worked with cattle breeding, purchasing cattle at a low price at the market, and after a certain time of fattening them, resell them at a higher price. Due to unfavorable weather and climate their business did not give positive results, and therefore the eldest and youngest son went to the Russian Federation as migrant workers. 

Amrullo needs to repair his house and prepare his son's wedding. Therefore he turned to IMON with the goal of receiving a loan to purchase building materials. Amrullo hopes very much for your charity and mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing his house

loans.name: Regina's Group

texts.en: Regina, who is in her mid 30's, is married with four children who are still at school. She has been operating a clothing and food business for 10 years. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.   This will be Regina's fifth loan from ID-Ghana, and she wants to use it to buy more clothing and food to sell to customers.  Regina will share this loan amount of GHS 2,400 with her group member and they will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and food to sell to customers.

loans.name: Merriam

texts.en:
Merriam is a loving and hardworking mother of two children. She always prioritizes her children's future, which is why she has not gotten tired of doing things to give them a better way of life. Merriam operates her variety store business within her locality. She is also engaged in a networking business wherein she offers beauty products and food supplements to generate additional income. Merriam's husband is a retired private employee who is now her partner in improving their businesses. The couple aims to keep improving their variety store and networking business.

For the improvement of the variety store, Merriam is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy cases of soft drinks, canned goods, biscuits, breads and other kinds of grocery items. Merriam hopes for continuous access to financial services from lenders to be able to expand her variety store and improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks, canned goods, biscuits, breads and other kinds of grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Pilar Jane

texts.en:
Pilar Jane is married and works hard to support her family in her buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Pilar Jane has been in this business for three years now.

Pilar Jane has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

In the future, Pilar Jane would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Shamilla

texts.en:
Shamilla is a 21-year-old female living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a cocoa garden, and also buys from other farmers to sell. In addition, she sells rice, fish, and beans to friends, relatives, and neighbours as her customers. She hopes to expand her business into new markets, and increase her profitability.

Due to seasonal changes, she gets low productivity from her cocoa, which she tries to cover with the sales from her side income. 

Shamilla is requesting a loan to buy fish, rice, beans, and cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish, rice, beans, and cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Meet Jenipher, who is a mother of four children and lives and farms in Nyamira. She loves poultry farming, where she gets to sell a lot of eggs. The income is used to cater to her family's needs.

She also produces and sells milk, eggs, and tea. Her biggest challenge in farming is disease attacking her livestock, especially poultry, which are so prone to disease.

Jenipher chose Juhudi Kilimo because of its faster processing of loans and easy accessiblity.

This poultry loan will help her add more poultry, which will produce more eggs and thus more income.

This will enable her to pay her children's school fees, and cater to her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Berlin

texts.en:
Berlin works hard to support her family. Berlin is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

Berlin requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish for drying. She has been in this business for 12 years now.

Berlin would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish for drying

loans.name: Pacifique Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ndalengwa est une commerçante et membre de l’association  d’affaires « Pacifique », entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 47 ans  et mère de 13 enfants dont 11 étudient et 2 sont encore bambins. La cliente est une vendeuse d’habits (pagnes). Elle installe ses marchandises au marché de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Son conjoint, lui aussi est commerçant de longue date. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 15 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 19 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite devenir grossiste, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Ndalengwa, age 47, is a merchant and member of the business group Pacifique. She is a dynamic and experienced entrepreneur, and the mother of 13 children, 11 of whom go to school while the other two are still toddlers. 

Ndalengwa sells clothing (pagnes) at the market in the city. She started her business with the help of her husband, a merchant himself who has been in this line of work for a long time. She later turned to the Hekima MFI for financial assistance. She has been practicing this activity  for 15 years. 

Ndalengwa will use this new loan to buy 19 pagnes. Her goals are to become a wholesaler, and to provide for her children’s needs with respect to food, clothing and schooling. 

Ndalengwa wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping businesswomen to become self-sufficient who cannot use the traditional banking system, especially in these critical times of war in the Eastern region.

loans.use: to buy 19 pagnes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm fibers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farming equipment such as drip tape and plastic film.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.es:
Loreta  brinda sus servicios como empleada domestica.
Ella vive en anticretico con su hija en Z/Pasankeri del Departamento de La Paz, aproximadamente a diez minutos del centro de la ciudad de La Paz.

El sueño de Loreta Julia es especializarse en el area de cocina gourmet y asi mejorar sus ingresos y brindarle mejor calidad de vida a su hija. Es de esta manera que ella solicita el crédito para tomar cursos de cocina.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Loreta provides services as a domestic employee.  She lives in ‘anticretico’ [an arrangement whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract] with her daughter in Z/Pasankeri in the La Paz department.  It is approximately ten minutes from the city of La Paz.

Loreta Julia’s dream is to specialize in the area of gourmet cooking.  This way she will improve her income and give her daughter a better quality of life.  That is why she is requesting a loan in order to take cooking courses.

This is the second time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the cost of a cooking course in order to improve her skills.

loans.name: Amartuvshin

texts.en:
Mr. Amartuvshin, 25 years old, lives with his mother and father in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been selling automobile spare parts since April, 2013. His mother and father run an automobile repair center. 

He has recently purchased an automobile and didn't fully pay its price. So he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to pay for the electric car. 

The advantage of an electric car is that it emits harmless pollutants into air and wastes less fuel. He is using this car for personal use, such as taking his parents to their workplace.

loans.use: to pay the remaining cost of an electric car.

loans.name: Perpetual's Group

texts.en: Perpetual is 28, married, and has one dependent child. She is a very brave and enterprising woman and has been able to make the most out of her work as a saleswoman, selling wigs. This is the fourth loan that Perpetual is applying for. She will invest it in the purchase of wigs to sell and increase her stock. The most important thing for her right now is to stabilize her finances, so that she can move into a full time business. This loan will be a great way to achieve this. Aside from Perpetual, there is one other group member who will invest this loan in her business by buying plates.

loans.use: to  purchase wigs to sell and increase her stock.

loans.name: Vali

texts.ru: Вали трудолюбивый и позитивный мужчина в возрасте 47 лет. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Живёт Вали со своей семьёй в маленьком посёлке. Чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь Вали много трудится. Вот уже более 15 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультуры, такой как пшеница, лук и другие овощи. Также он имеет несколько голов скота, которых выращивает для дальнейшей продажи и надеется получить от этого также хороший доход. Вали ещё ведёт торговлю фруктами.  Он имеет землю площадью 2,16га, где он выращивает также виноград, лук и арбузы. Его старший  сын в данное время находится в России на заработках, а второй сын работает в местной аптеке продавцом. Сейчас Вали хочет закупить семена для посева, но у него недостаточно собственных средств для этого. Поэтому Вали обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку семян для посева. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Vali is a hardworking and positive 47 year old man. He has a wife and four children. Vali lives with his family in a small village. Vali works hard so that he can make a living. He has more than 15 years of experience cultivating crops such as, wheat, onions, and various vegetables. He also has a few head of cattle which are grown for sale and he hopes will gain him a good income. Vali still trades fruit. He has a plot of land that is 2.16 hectares where he grows grapes, onions, and watermelons. His oldest son is, at this time, in Russia for work, but his second oldest son works as a local pharmacist. Now Vali wants to buy seeds for sowing, but he doesn't have enough funds for this. Therefore Vali is asking Arvand and wants to borrow credit to buy seeds for sowing. He hopes for a positive outcome and is thankful in advance for Arvand's support.

loans.use: purchase seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 61 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Aurelia runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 15 years, and sells a variety of items such as noodles, laundry soap, shampoo, canned goods, and other groceries. 

Aurelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Egina

texts.en:
Egina is 50 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Egina is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  She has been in pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman  who is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Elvira is 36 years old and has two children who are in school.  Elvira has a livestock business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Elvira has been in this business for two years. In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Emileta

texts.en:
Emileta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.(NWTF) in order to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.  Emileta successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Emileta's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 50-year-old, married woman living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has grown old and sits idle at home. 

Safia's elder son owns a butcher shop. He earns sufficient income for the whole family. In the beginning, he purchased a small quantity of beef from the market and then sold it in his locality. Now, he has gotten a lot of experience and has retained a list of good customers in a short time. 

Now, Safia's son wants to buy a bull calf to produce more beef to sell, but he does not have enough cash in hand. Therefore, Safia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her son can buy a bull calf to produce beef.

loans.use: to buy her son a bull calf to produce beef to sell.

loans.name: Benard's Group

texts.en:
Benard is a member of Bidii Group in Matete District.  He is pictured here in a group of four One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 36 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Benard has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum for cultivation.							

Benard is 65 years old and has been a farmer for three years.  Benard works as a farmer to provide for his nine children.  The community and other farmers know Benard as friendly and hardworking.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community groups such as the men's group, prayer group and burial committee.  Benard described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.							

The 2014 Long Rains season won’t be Benard’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He first joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  As an active member in his community, Benard also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member.  Benard plans on using future profits from the harvest to send children to school, repair the home, save for the future and buy a cow.  His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he has more profits from harvest, was able to save money and feed the family.  Benard also joined One Acre Fund because he wanted to  eliminate hunger in his home.  							
							

Benard and the Bidii Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline, a mother of four children, farms in the Nyamira area, which is popular for banana growing. She has been farming for three years. She produces and sells milk, eggs, tea, and vegetables. She enjoys mixed farming and most especially dairy, and vegetable farming. Her major challenge is a lack of finances for her farming activities.

Roseline chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer low interest rates on their loans. During the training, she learned that microfinance institutions like Juhudi Kilimo give loans to small income earners that will help them grow economically. 

This loan will help her pay for her children's school fees, as that is her highest expense, and also to improve on her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia is a 22-year-old married business woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells second-hand clothes, and has been in business for three years. 

She has managed to provide for her family and look after her school-going children by providing them with all the school requirements. 

Like other people in the same business, she is affected by high taxes levied on second-hand clothes. Her dream is to save and construct a permanent house for her family.

Jovia will use the loan to buy land for her family.

loans.use: to buy land for her family.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 26 años de edad, para generar los ingresos con los que cubre los gastos de su hogar tiene un negocio de siembra de tomate y darle mantenimiento a una manzana de café, trabaja a tiempo completo y es poyada por su esposo y su hijo, por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema que le evite seguir trabajando.
Con el préstamo comprará semilla de tomate, fertilizantes, plaguicidas e insecticidas, son insumos tanto para el mantenimiento del cultivo del tomate como para el mantenimiento de la cosecha de café, espera aumentar su producción, tener productos de mejor calidad, mejorar su economía, para seguir aportando con los gastos familiares y tener la liquidez necesaria para cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas.
Sueña con que su hijo aprenda a trabajar de manera independiente y ser propietarios del terreno en el que cultivan.
texts.en:
Teresa, age 55, lives with her husband and her 26 year old son.  In order to generate income to cover the household expenses, she has a business of growing tomatoes and providing maintenance to a ‘manzana’ [1.75 acres] of coffee.  She works full time, and her husband and her son support her.  So far she has not had any problems that keep her from continuing her work.

She will use the loan to buy tomato seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and insecticides.  They are supplies used as much for the maintenance of the tomato crop as for the maintenance of the coffee crop.  She hopes to increase her production, to have better quality products, and to improve her finances.  She wants to do this in order to continue contributing towards the family expenses and to have the liquidity needed to punctually make her payments.

She dreams of her son learning to work independently and being the owners of the land that they cultivate.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas lives in the Nyamira area of Nyanza, which is a popular banana growing region. He is married and has 5 children. He has practiced farming for 15 years, where he produces and sells tea. He enjoys tea farming because it has good returns and the bonuses he receives out of it, but his challenge is when there are no rains and the tea plantation doesn't do well.

Thomas chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they do cater for the growth and welfare of small scale farmers. This loan will enable him to start poultry farming. This will mean more income to him because of the egg production, and will thus help him give his children better educations and also improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Abamwi Women's Group

texts.en:
Mathew, whose hand is raised in the group picture, is a 38-year-old married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He sells beans, rice, cassava flour and fish to people around town. In addition to that, he generates income from cocoa harvests, which has helped him to improve his household and provide school fees for his children.

Despite his progress, price fluctuations and weather changes affect his business a lot. He is a member of Abamwi Women's Group whereby each member guarantees the others to get a loan. Mathew is requesting a loan to buy beans, rice, cassava flour and fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, casava flour and fish to sell.

loans.name: Patima

texts.en:
Patima is 41 years old.  She is married and has two grown sons.  Patima lives the village of Tamarisi and works at the local book store as a salesperson with a small monthly salary.  After work, Patima runs a small agricultural business with the support of her husband. They cultivate a plot of land and grow alfalfa (Lucerne) there, which is used as cattle feed locally. 
Patima feeds her own livestock: two milk cows and two calves with the harvested Lucerne and the rest of the product is sold.  Patima makes cheese with the milk and sells it in her district. Their existing income is modest and the family decided to start another business. Specifically, with a Kiva loan, Patima and her elder son will purchase a stock of food products such as sausages and various of meat products, and distribute the goods at the village grocery stores.  Patima's son owns a car and will use it in deliveries. 
The family hopes that the business initiative will be successful and the family's fund will significantly increase.

loans.use: to buy food products in bulk for resale

loans.name: Al-Shamokh Group

texts.en:
This group is called “Al-Shamokh”, and it consists of five women from Sana`a, Yemen. They have very good experience working together and helping each other out. 

They applied for a loan of 230,000 YER. 

One of the members is Yathrb. She is a very hardworking person who very much wants to get ahead. She comments that she always strives to the maximum to be able to help her family. She says that she sells all types of cosmetics and perfumes and thanks to this work, she’s been able to get ahead and help her family. 

She’s asking for a loan to buy cosmetics and perfumes to stock up and be able to meet customer demands, since she has many pending orders that she’d like to be able to fill.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfumes for expanding her business.

loans.name: Akbari

texts.en:
Akbari is a 46-year-old, married woman and the mother of six children. She has been running a business selling dry fruits, sugar and brown sugar with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. They have been doing it for many years and have become famous in their community for providing good quality stock. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, Akbari has improved her business. Currently, she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more stocks of peanuts, brown sugar and walnuts. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of the profits on expanding her business. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of peanuts, brown sugar and walnuts.

loans.name: Sorayia

texts.en: Sorayia is 30 years old and a married woman and mother of two children. The man shown in the photo is Sorayia’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Sorayia has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Sorayia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
As the married mother of four children, Mae works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Mae is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty-five loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 41 years old.  She is married and has two children, one of whom is still in school.  Erlinda is in the livestock business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.  Erlinda has been buying and selling livestock for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 21 years old and is sixth of nine children in the family. His mother Isabelita supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines. Jessie is studying Computer Hardware Services and is currently in his second of this two-year course. He is borrowing 7,500 PHP for higher education costs for the second semester of the 2013-14 school year.

When he graduates, Jessie plans to be gainfully employed so he can help improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for higher education costs.

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
Ma. Lorena is 36 years old and married with one child.  With one child currently in school, Ma. Lorena works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. Lorena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks, such as canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, biscuits, noodles, etc. to sell.

Ma. Lorena has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Ma. Lorena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks, such as canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, biscuits, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rodrigo, Jr.

texts.en: Rodrigo, Jr. is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an e-loading (mobile prepaid credit) business in the Philippines. He is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional prepaid credit to resell to customers. Rodrigo, Jr. has been in this business for three years, but he earns more income from his general store. Rodrigo, Jr. has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. His dream is to save money to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid credit to resell to customers.

loans.name: Juma's Group

texts.en:
Chebuna is a group of five group leader farmers in Chwele District.  Juma has volunteered and was selected to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 56 other individual farmers represented by this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here, but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Juma is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with 10 children. Juma is 58 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 18 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Juma is very active in his community and is involved in the prayer group. He described his harvest last year as good. He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue enjoying the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.
							
The 2013 Long Rains season won’t be Juma’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He first joined in 2008 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods.  As an active member in his community, Juma also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative. Juma plans to use future profits from the harvest to send his children to school.  His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he was able to feed the family.							

Juma and the Chebuna Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Orlando Antonio

texts.es: Don Orlando es habitante del municipio de Juigalpa, un señor que vela por el bienestar de su hogar, casado tiene un hijo quien muy pronto ira a la universidad, Orlando labora para una institución del estado como responsable de sanidad pública, de sus ingresos apoya a su familia. Solicita este crédito para cambiar todo el piso y el techo de su vivienda los cuales están muy deteriorados por los años de sol y lluvia, gracias al financiamiento podrá ajustarse a su salario para ir pagando en cuotas pequeñas a largo plazo, lo que le dará la dicha de ver su humilde casita en buenas condiciones.
texts.en: Orlando is a resident of the municipality of Juigalpa. He is a man who watches out for the well-being of his household. Orlando is married and has a son who will very shortly go to university. Orlando works for a national institution as a public health manager. With his wages, he supports his family. Orlando is requesting this loan in order to change the floor and roof of his house, which are very deteriorated from years of sun and rain. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to adjust his salary so that he can pay off his debt in small installments over the long term. This will give him the blessing of seeing his humble house in good condition.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets, cement, sand, blocks, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Shehnaz Bibi

texts.en:
Shehnaz bibi is an active, 38-year-old woman. She has three children, two sons and a daughter. All are studying, in fourth and eighth class, respectively. Her husband is an energetic mason.

Shehnaz bibi has excellent embroidery skills, and she sells embroidered products in the market. She is running this business, in order to contribute some amount to the family's income and to keep herself busy. She does this, because she does not like to waste her skills and precious time by sitting idly at home. Her business is successful, and the demand for her embroidered products is increasing, day by day.

Therefore, Shehnaz bibi has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use it to purchase fabric and packs of thread, of various colors.

loans.use: to pay for fabrics and thread, for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Lylebeth

texts.en:
Lylebeth is 37 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Lylebeth is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lylebeth has been in pig fattening for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling coconut shells.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Mujeres Al Poder” y está conformada por 08 mujeres emprendedoras dispuestas a comenzar a trabajar. Natividad de 43 años  es separada con 02 hijos independientes, actualmente  brinda servicio de locutorio. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Natividad ha logrado brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de teléfonos y de esta manera mejorar la atención. El deseo de Natividad es seguir prosperando en su negocio. El nuevo grupo “Mujeres Al Poder” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Natividad se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo blanco con rayas negras. En la parte superior al lado izquierdo está Amelia Noemi la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
This is the new group, “Mujeres Al Poder”, that is made up of 8 enterprising women who are ready to start working. 

Natividad, 43 years old, is separated with two independent children.   Currently she provides phone booth service, and with a lot of effort and dedication, Natividad has been able to provide a better quality of life for her family.

She will use this loan to purchase telephones, and in this way, she can improve her service. Natividad’s desire is to continue to be successful in her business.

The new group “Mujeres al Poder” thanks the people who have made this loan possible.  Natividad, who is wearing a polo shirt with black and white stripes, is seated in front on the right.  Amelia Noemi, who could not arrive on time because of work, is seen at top left.

loans.use: to purchase telephones.

loans.name: M. Manzoor

texts.en:
M. Manzoor is a milk seller by profession. He has been growing his herd of cattle through breeding. Now he has many buffaloes that produce milk. He is famous in his hometown for the quality and freshness of his milk. He preserves milk for household usage and sells milk in his hometown.
M. Manzoor is a 61-year-old father of seven children. Now he has grown old and weak as well. Nowadays, most of the time he is sick; due to weakness, he cannot perform his duties regarding producing and selling milk. He wants to give his obligations to his younger son so that he can continue  his forefather’s business. Before giving his obligations, he wants to maintain the cowshed and complete the herd. This is the reason he wants to buy an additional heifer to increase his herd. 
This is M. Manzoor's  first loan with BRAC and Kiva. With the loan amount, he will maintain the cowshed and will buy a heifer to increase the herd. He will be very happy after receiving this loan because the new heifer will cause his herd to grow.
He thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a heifer and maintain the cowshed.

loans.name: Rita Verónica

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Rita, tiene 47 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas mayores de edad e independientes.
Doña Rita es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para salir adelante, ella además de trabajar como secretaria de un abogado también se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende todo tipo de víveres además de  legumbres, verduras y frutas,  como  ella trabaja todos los días le paga a una persona para que atienda su negocio hasta que ella pueda ir, este negocio lo comenzó con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo y gracias a esto  pudo sacar adelante sola a sus hijas.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para surtir más su tienda, va a comprar toda clase de víveres. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 14 años y le gusta porque así ella empezó su negocio. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the Tosagua Loan Team meets in the city of Tosagua. It's a dynamic city where most of its residents are in agriculture or raising animals, as it's an area with a lot of vegetation.

This is where Rita, 47 years old, lives. She is separated and has two grown, independent daughters from her former relationship. Rita is a very hard-working woman and she's always enjoyed working to get ahead. In addition to working as a secretary for a lawyer, she also has a business of her own. She has a small grocery store that she runs out of her home where she sells all sorts of supplies, including a variety of vegetables and fruits. Since she works every day, she pays a person to run her store until she can be there. She started this business with a loan from the team, and thanks to that, she was able to get her daughters ahead by herself. 

She will use this loan to stock her store with all kinds of supplies. She has been on the loan team for fourteen years and she likes it because it's what enabled her to launch her business. Her goals are to get ahead with her business and see her store grow a little more every day.

loans.use: stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fashion blouses, jeans, tee-shirts, etc., to expand her sales.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a bamboo-weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional bamboo for her business. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo for her bamboo-weaving business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 31-year-old married woman. For three years, she has been running a business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread winner at that point in time. 

With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 40,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR )to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Genad

texts.en:
Genad is a 42-year-old married man with three children living in Batumi city. His wife works as a teacher at the nearby village school and earns a small monthly income. Genad’s elder daughter is a university attendant, and his youngest go to public school. Genad is employed at the local construction company as a builder and earns a monthly income.

As existing funds are not enough for the five-member family, Genad decided to start his own business. All of the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. The start-up program that is the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 3,500 USD to purchase a secondhand car. Genad will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them intercity. Genad is very enthusiastic and a hardworking person with a great desire to ensure that his children receive a good education to progress in life. This credit will be a great support to the family.

Genad is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand car and start Taxi business

loans.name: Mariedel

texts.en:
Mariedel is 36 years old and married with two children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.  Mariedel has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Mariedel aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gayetri

texts.en:
Gayetri is a 33-year-old lady married to Ashta. They live in Maynaguri village and have two daughters who are studying in class VI (grade 6) and class VIII (grade 8) respectively. Gayetri and her husband both are illiterate, but know to sign their names.

Her husband runs a business selling clothes door to door, and Gayetri is a housewife. Due to lack of money, her husband could not purchase a large variety of good-quality clothes, so their products are not up to the mark. They have faced lots of problems to run their family and to continue making money. 

Gayetri decided to help her husband by taking a loan of INR 13,000 from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase different types of clothes of good quality, as per the demand of the market. As they are living in a kaccha house (made of mud and straw), there are some risks of clothes being ruined by rats or ants. In spite of that, Gayetri’s idea is that it is a very profitable business. 

She has a future plan to open a shop of their own so they can do business on a larger scale and reach more customers. Gayetri is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes for retail sale.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha lives in the city of Batumi. He is 47 years old and married. He lives with his wife, retired mother, and school-aged son. Gocha’s wife is a nurse at the local hospital and gets a monthly salary. Gocha is, at the moment, unemployed. He’s decided to start a business, because their existing income isn’t enough for the family, and their living conditions are poor.

Gocha's loan request was approved, in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and restart-up credit with soft conditions, to vulnerable poor people. Such people do not have access to other credit products, because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers,” on account of their low incomes. With the received credit, Gocha will purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase, and Gocha will be able to improve the living conditions of the family in the future

loans.use: to buy a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Tsolmon

texts.en: Mr. Tsolmon, 28 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife both have been working as product sorters at a cashmere factory since 2008. Their four-year-old son goes to kindergarten. Tsolmon is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy fenced land from his neighbor. On this land, he will grow vegetables this next spring. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to buy fenced land to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is 30 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and 5 children. She has had her own business for 2 years, and it is her source of income. She sells sugar, rice, beans, eggs, soft drinks, etc. 

Elmira has not had many customers lately and that’s why she has decided to widen her assortment of goods. She is asking a loan of 3000 somoni (TJS). With the loan, she is going to buy dairy products, meats and cold cuts. She wishes to satisfy the demands from her customers and always keep her store well-stocked. 

Her goal is to always keep her business brisk, as it is the source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, meats and cold cuts to sell.

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es: María de 42 años de edad es madre soltera de dos hijos de 14 años y 16 años de edad  y habita junto a ellos en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras de forma ambulante y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a sus hijos. Desea hacer algunas mejoras a su vivienda que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir. Actualmente, las paredes de la vivienda no están repelladas lo cual ha tomado la decisión de hacerlo con el fin de protegerlas de la suciedad y el deterioro de la misma. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento para proceder al repello de las paredes de la vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Marís is 42 years old and a single mother to two children, aged 16 and 14 years old each.  María owns the house where she and her children live.  María  sells vegetables as a street vendor and this work provides an income with which to support her children.  María would like to do some renovation in her home, which she built with a lot of effort.  Currently the walls of her home are not plastered and so she has taken the decision to do this, in order to protect them from dirt and deterioration. To do this work, María is applying for a loan from FUSAI so as to buy cement to plaster the walls of her home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement to plaster the walls of her house.

loans.name: Elba Alicia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Elba, tiene 78 años de edad, hace varios años murió su esposo pero de esa relación tienen 11 hijos mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive una nieta de 11 años la cual es su compañía y que estudia en escuela. 
Doña Elba para salir adelante sola se dedican al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo,  esta actividad la realizaba con su esposo pero luego se vio obligada a seguir en este negocio sola para sacar a sus hijos adelante, ella instala un pequeño puesto en el centro de la ciudad lugar en la cual muchos comerciantes ofrecen sus productos, aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza puerta a puerta o por pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Tiene más de 28 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual saco adelante a sus hijos y ahora le sirve para salir adelante ella sola con su nieta.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y seguros. Sus sueños tener un gran local.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the Tosagua Loan Team meets in the city of Tosagua. It's a dynamic city where most of its residents are in agriculture or raising animals, as it's an area with a lot of vegetation.
This is where Elba, age 78, lives. Her husband died several years ago, but the two of them had 11 children, all grown and independent. One 11-year-old granddaughter lives with her. She goes to school and keeps Elba company.

To get ahead by herself, Elba sells clothing of all sorts. She started in this line of work with her husband, but later found herself needing to continue alone so that she could support her children. She opened a small stand in the middle of town where a lot of vendors sells their goods, although most of her sales come from either door-to-door sales or by direct order from customers. She has over 28 years of experience at this job now, and has been able to support her children, and now herself and her granddaughter.

Elba will use this loan to buy more merchandise, including pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing. She's been on the loan team since the beginning, and she likes it because the loans are fast and secure. She dreams of having a big store.

loans.use: buy pants, blouses, and children's clothing for resale

loans.name: María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 65 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, con ella vive uno de sus hijos con sus pequeños hijos. El marido es chofer. 
Doña María es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa, sabanas, edredones, zapatos y productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, realiza sus recorridos  cuatro días por semana allí mismo deja y cobra  ya que  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene más de 11  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual en ocasiones salen adelante ya que su marido no tiene trabajo fijo.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, sabanas, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Ella está desde  el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la puntualidad de los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, every two weeks the Tosagua communal bank group meets. This area is known for being very dynamic. The majority of inhabitants make a living in agriculture and raising livestock because it is a region with much vegetation. 

This is where María lives. She is 65 years old and married. She has four adult children. María lives with one of her children and her young grandchildren. Her husband works as a driver. María is a housewife who, in order to earn her own money to help her husband with the household expenses, sells clothing, sheets, quilts, shoes, as well as Avon and Yanbal products (women's beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories). She sells her products door-to-door, four days a week. She allows her customers to make purchases on credit and she collects payments weekly. María has been working in this way for over 11 years. At times, this helps her family to move forward because her husband no longer has a steady job. 

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, sheets, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics. María was an original member of the communal bank group and she likes the group because of the punctuality of the loans. María's dreams are to move forward and to stay in good health.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, sheets, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Eufemia Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Eufemia, tiene 37 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  13, 10 y 9 años de edad, los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Eufemia es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar hace cinco años y con la ayuda de uno de los créditos instalo un pequeño bazar en su casa, allí vende ropa, zapatos, bisuterías, tarjetas, perfumes y obsequios de toda clase. Trabaja todos los días durante todo el día, así ella se gana algo por el bien de su familia y está al tanto de sus hijos ya que es un negocio que lo tiene en su propia casa.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta ya que con los créditos empezó su negocio que hoy le permite ganarse algo por su cuenta. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the Tosagua Loan Team meets in the city of Tosagua. It's a dynamic city where most of its residents are in agriculture or raising animals, as it's an area with a lot of vegetation. This is where Eufemia, 37 years old, lives. She's married, and she and her husband have three children, ages 13, 10 and 9. Her children are all in school, and her husband is a farmer.

Eufemia is a homemaker, but to earn some additional income and help her husband with the household expenses, she opened a small retail shop in her home five years ago with the help of a loan. There she sells clothing, shoes, jewelry, phone cards, perfumes, and all sorts of gifts. She works every day during the day and is able to earn a little bit to help the family while still being there for her children, since the business is in her home.

With this loan, she will buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and undergarments. She's been on the Loan Team for ten years and she likes that the loans let her open her business that, in turn, lets her earn something of her own.  She dreams of seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: buy perfumes and cosmetics for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family home

loans.name: Sughra

texts.en:
Sughra is 45; she is living with her seven children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband and son have been selling fruits for many years, they sell seasonal fresh fruits in their hometown. They use a four-wheel manual cart for selling.  As hawkers, they can easily be reached near the people. 
Sughra will distribute the loan amount equally between them, so they can increase the stock on a daily basis and can generate more income. Sughra wants to save the excess profit amount so that she can utilize these savings for future and sudden needs for her family.

loans.use: To help her husband and son buy fresh and seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en:
Duyen is 44-years-old and married with two children.  She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a general store in front of their house. 

She started this business 11 years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme  âgé(e) de 33 ans. Elle est mariée.
Akossiwa travaille comme coiffeuse mais ajoute à cette activité la vente de produits de beauté depuis 2006. Elle vend ses produits de beauté(tissages,mèches...) à ses clients et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Akossiwa a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter  des produits de beauté, des mèches et divers.. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, l’agrandir  afin de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is 33 years old and married.

Akossiwa works as a hair stylist and has also been selling beauty products since 2006. She sells beauty products (weaves, extensions) to her clients and buys her supplies in Lomé. 

Akossiwa has requested a third loan from WAGES to buy beauty products, extensions, and other items. She would like to reinvest in her business and grow it, so that she can take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and hair entensions.

loans.name: Besik

texts.en:
Besik is 29-years-old and lives in the village of Maghlaki. He is married with two children and lives with his father. Besik works at the local bakery as a baker and gets a small-sized monthly salary.

His income is hardly enough to cover feeding and household expenses.  That’s why Besik decided to apply for this loan and start his greenhouse business. He is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders offer him, since thanks to their help he will be able to purchase all the needed materials for his greenhouse construction. He plans to grow various greens in the wintertime and plant tomatoes and cucumbers in the summer. He will sell his harvest the whole year and generate income. Thanks to this loan, he will improve their quality of life and increase the family funds. Besik awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase materials to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Charlotte Jelliffer

texts.en:
Charlotte Jelliffer is 21 and single. Despite the hardships of living, she dreams to become financially stable in their village. To generate income, she runs a small variety store in her community. She aims to make it profitable in order to earn a higher income. 

Due to insufficient capital, Charlotte Jelliffer is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000.00 to buy chips, canned goods, noodles, beverages, soaps, assorted candies, soft drinks and seasonings to sell. She's hoping that someday, her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy chips, canned goods, noodles, beverages, soaps, assorted candies, soft drinks and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 30 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Helen has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en: Dioscora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional tools and gear for her business. Dioscora has been in this business for 13 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and gear for her business

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime works hard to support his family. He is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  Jaime requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for his fishing business.  He has been in this business for nine years now.  In the future, Jaime would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net for his fishing business.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 30 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Nena is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock for her business. Nena has been raising livestock for 2 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Nena is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock for her business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a business raising goats in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is 40 years old and married with four children, who are all in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Avelina has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 38 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs. Nancy has been raising pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Amar

texts.en: Mrs. Amar, 28 years old, lives with her husband, daughter and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a manager at a student exchange agency since 2008.
