Her husband runs his business. Their daughter goes to kindergarten. His mother has retired from work and stays at home. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it becomes very cold during winter. So, Mrs. Amar is requesting a loan of 7,600,000 MNT to buy a low pressure heater, vacuum insulated windows, hardwood flooring and fiberglass for their house renovation. As a result, this family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy vacuum insulated windows and a low pressure heater.

loans.name: Enie Magdalena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Enie, tiene 60 años de edad, está separada pero  de esta relación tiene una hija de 20 años que estudia en universidad y vive con ella.
Doña Enie es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo darle la mejor educación a su hija para que ella tenga un mejor porvenir, es por eso que ella hace muchos años atrás y con la ayuda de los créditos empezó un pequeño negocio en su casa, vende sodas, aguas, jugos, dulces y helados de sabores que ella misma prepara, los fines de semana ella se va con sus productos a unas canchas deportivas de la localidad lugar donde vende mucho sus productos. Ella también cría pollos en su casa con lo cual se gana algo extra que le sirvan para mejorar su situación.
Este crédito es para alimentos para los pollos y para comprar, sodas, aguas y jugos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le han dado para salir adelante. Su sueño es que su hija sea una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the Tosagua Loan Team meets in the city of Tosagua. It's a dynamic city where most of its residents are in agriculture or raising animals, as it's an area with a lot of vegetation.
Enie is one of those people who likes working hard to get ahead and through her efforts, she has been able to provide her daughter with the education so that she will have a better future. That was why, years ago with the help of a loan, she started her small business out of her home selling sodas, water, juices, sweets, and ice cream of all different flavors that she made herself.  On weekends, she would go to various sporting pitches in the area where she was able to sell a lot of her goods. She also raises chickens in her home to gain a little bit extra to improve her situation.

This loan will be used to buy feed for the chickens and also to buy soda, water, and juices. She's been on the Loan Team since the start, and she likes the help it's always given her in her drive to get ahead. Her dream is to see her daughter become a professional.

loans.use: buy assorted beverages for her snack shop and feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. The man shown in the photo is Naseem’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Naseem has applied for a loan of Rs 45,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some spare auto parts. This will help him to provide a better transportation service. Naseem is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to help her husband buy new tires and some spare auto parts.

loans.name: Aleksandre

texts.en:
Aleksandre is 19-years-old from the Bolnisi district. He lives with his brother and pensioner grandmother. Aleksandre and his brother have been involved in the agricultural business from early childhood, as their parents were farmers and this is a traditional activity for the family. 

Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Aleksandre was unable to study for a professional career. He works hard on the family-owned agricultural land, growing maize and potatoes. He always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. As the family has only a seasonal income, Aleksandre decided to start a trading business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The start-up program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1,000 GEL for purchasing calves.  After the calves are purchased, he will start trading them among his villagers. He will be involved in a husbandry business and will start producing dairy products in future.

The new business initiative will give him a chance to have financial stability and a monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase calves and begin a trading business

loans.name: Ildaura Floricelda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Ildaura, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad,  uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Ildaura para ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de víveres, granos, legumbres, verduras, frutas, helados además de ciertas cosas de bazar y papelería, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo y su esposo  le ayuda en su trabajo cuando ellos pueden, lleva más de 12 años con su negocio y este lo empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear para surtir más su tienda, va a comprar toda clase de víveres. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace  12  años y le gusta por la ayuda para seguir aumentando su negocio. Sus metas son seguir adelante mejorando su negocio para satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the "Tosagua" loan group meets every fifteen days. This city is known for being very active. Most of the inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry. It is also known for its vast greenery. 

Ildaura lives in this city. She is sixty-three years old. She is married, and from this relationship, she has five children who are now older. One of her children still lives with her. Her husband works in agriculture. 

In order to help with living expenses, Ilduara works in trade. She has a small provisions store in her home where she sells all sorts of supplies: grains, legumes, vegetables, fruits, and ice cream as well as certain stationary supplies. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m.—and sometimes even later. Her husband and son help her with her work when they can. She has had this business for more than twelve years, and she started it with the first loan that she received from the bank.

She will use this loan to further stock her store. She will buy all sorts of supplies. She has been a part of this loan group for twelve years, and she likes it because of the help to continue expanding her business. Her goals are to move forward and improve her store to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ma, Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria Lourdes is 41 years old and blessed with two children. She has been widowed for seven years. According to her, being a single parent is quite difficult, but she's doing her best to meet the needs of her family. 

For the past 20 years, Maria Lourdes has owned and operated a food stall wherein she has earned a minimum net income of PHP 5000 a month. With her aim to develop and strengthen her food stall business, Maria Lourdes is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase curls (snack food), soft drinks, meat and vegetables to cook and sell. She hopes to obtain this amount of loan in order to generate a bigger income and provide her family with a better way of living.

loans.use: to purchase curls (snack food), soft drinks, meat and vegetables to cook and sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Hiba is a 25 year old married woman from Jabalia city. She lives with her husband and two kids, one son and one daughter, in a very simple house. Her husband is a worker in a local firm with a low income. His is the only source of income for the family. Hiba and her husband would like to improve the family's living conditions by buying all the needed items.
 
Hiba has taken a 1900 USD loan from FATEN. This loan  will help her to buy a solar system for heating water. By taking this loan, Hiba will provide her family with hot water, especially in the winter.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family home.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo. Hiba,18 years old, is a young, single lady from Bet Lahya, near Jabalia city. She lives with her family in a very simple house. Her father is a worker in a local firm with a medium income. This is the only source of income for the family. Hiba is a university student; she studies engineering in her first year. She is a very clever student, and she would like to finish her studies and find a job in the future. 
Hiba took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Hiba will be able to do her homework, and write her reports easily using special engineering programs.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis de 31 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijo de 8 años y un sobrino de 9 años de edad. Desde muy joven aprendió el oficio de carpintería y ahora en día es lo que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Tiene muchos clientes que cada día lo prefieren más ya que hace trabajos de buena calidad y a muy buenos precios.  Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir su vivienda la cual es su principal patrimonio para futura herencia de sus hijos. Desea reparar el techo de la vivienda el cual se encuentra dañado y cuando llueve el agua se filtra dañando sus pocas pertenencias. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de teja y lámina galvanizada para reparar el techo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Luis, 31, lives in his own house along with his life partner, his small son of 8 years and a nephew, 9. Since he was very young, he learned the trade of carpentry and today this is what lets him win the bread. He has many customers who prefer him more every day since he does good quality work and at very good prices. 

With much effort, he has achieved constructing his home, which is his main asset for future inheritance by his children. He wishes to repair the roof of the house, which is damaged. When it rains the water filters in, damaging his few belongings. Therefore, he is applying for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of tiles and galvanized aluminum to repair the roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy: tiles and galvanized aluminum to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Egesa's Group

texts.en:
Egesa is a member of Imara Group in Busia District.  He is pictured here in a group of 9 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 82 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Egesa has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Egesa is a reliable member of the community. He is married and has 3 children. Egesa is 38 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 15 years to support his family. In addition to this, Egesa is very active in his community and is involved in groups like the men's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee. He described his harvest last year as not with One Acre Fund. He hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer he is able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program!
							
The 2013 Long Rains season will be Egesa’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, to earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school. As an active member in his community, Egesa has also volunteered his time to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Farmers. He believes that his life will improve as a One Acre Fund farmer.

Egesa and the Imara Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa is 70 years old and married. She has ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nicolasa has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Nicolasa has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Meet Damaris who is a farmer living in Nyamira. She has four children and has been farming for two years, producing and selling milk, eggs and tea. She enjoys tea farming because it covers a large area of land, there is more production and she receives bonuses for the tea produced. Her major challenge is insufficient funds.

Damaris chose Juhudi Kilimo because of their low interest rate loans. During the training, she learned that Juhudi Kilimo invests so much in young farmers to help them improve their lifestyles. She says that this loan will help her to construct a zero grazing unit which will create a very good environment for her cows to produce more. This will bring in more income; thus, she will provide a better education for her children and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 58 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Norma is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Norma has been in pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: M. Yaseen

texts.en: M. Yaseen is 48 years old and the married father of ten children. The income generated through his present herd is insufficient to cover all his household expenses, so he decided to enhance his business of milk sales. He has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in his locality. With the support of BRAC Pakistan, he has gradually improved his business, and has recently requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase another buffalo. This will help him to increase his sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for him. M. Yaseen thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an additional buffalo for getting milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase educational equipment and pay for tuition.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 35 year old married man from Jabalia city. He lives with his wife  and six kids (one son and five daughters) in a very simple house. Mohammad is a worker in a local firm with a low income. His earnings are the only source of income for the family. Mohammad and his wife would like to improve the family's living conditions by buying all the needed items. 

Mohammad has taken a $1000USD loan from FATEN. This loan  will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family home. By taking this loan, Mohammad will provide his family with hot water, especially in the winter. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family home.

loans.name: Yadira Del Socorro

texts.es: Yadira del Socorro acompañada con cuatro hijos mayores de edad originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país,  es una microempresaria la cual se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa nueva, zapatos, cosméticos, productos plásticos, chinería entre otros por encargos, las compras las realiza al contado en mercados de otros departamentos del país, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales por encargos de forma ambulante, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano, a entregar sus productos y ha captar nuevos clientes, el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo en la compra de diversos estilos de ropa nueva de niños, adultos, pantalones, cosméticos, zapatos, adornos, entre otros ya que sus demandas ha crecido mas para estas fechas próximas de diciembre. Yadira agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Yadira del Socorro has four grown children and is from one of the towns in the Chinandega region located in the western part of the country. She is a micro entrepreneur who buys and sells general merchandise such as: various styles of new clothing, shoes, cosmetics, plastic products, and knick-knacks to order. She buys her merchandise for cash at markets in other areas of the country.  Her sales are for cash and credit to steady and occasional customers by orders that she takes going door-to-door. She begins her workday very early, delivering her products and trying to get new customers.

The purpose of this loan is for working capital so she can buy different styles of new clothing for children and adults, trousers, cosmetics, shoes, and decorations, among other things, because demand is greater at this December holiday time.  Yadira is very grateful for the support that Kiva investors provide to people of limited financial resources.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as: cosmetics, different styles of new clothing for children and adults, shoes, and plastic items, among others.

loans.name: Santos Isaac

texts.es:
Santos, está satisfecho con el servicio que la institución le da y por los múltiples beneficios que los créditos le dan, por lo que solicita capital para comprar una vaca y pagar mozos que le ayuden a recolectar la cosecha, con lo que su negocio estará fortalecido y la producción de maíz será entregada a sus clientes con puntualidad.
Con el préstamo anterior pudo invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios con los que  su negocio se fortaleció, ha mejorado sus ingresos, la calidad de vida que tiene junto a su familia es mucho mejor y ha podido cancelar sus cuotas
texts.en:
Santos is satisfied with the service he gets from the institution and for the many benefits of the loans.  He's requesting capital to buy a cow and pay laborers who help him gather the harvest.  This will strengthen his business and he'll deliver the corn crop to his customers punctually.

With the previous loan he was able to invest in buying the agricultural inputs he needed to strengthen his business.  His income has improved, his family's quality of life is much better, and he has been able to pay his debts.

loans.use: to buy a cow and to pay laborers

loans.name: Orbesa

texts.en: Orbesa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish for making dried fish. Orbesa has been in this business for five years. Orbesa  also earns income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish for making dried fish.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 54 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Nida works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. Nida has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soap, rice and other groceries. In the future Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Perly

texts.en: Perly is 33 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her livestock.  Perly has been raising livestock for five years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her livestock.

loans.name: Martha Milady

texts.es:
Martha, disfruta de su familia compuesta por su esposo y dos hijos de 7 y 2 años, no posee ayuda del extranjero, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol); es una actividad que aprendió de sus padres la desempeña con ayuda de su esposo y también contrata mozos.
Con el crédito comprará insumos agrícolas y pagara mano de obra, tales como fertilizantes, plaguicidas e insecticidas, para tener una abundante producción y granos de mayor calidad, espera aumentar sus ventas y tener ingresos mayores para ir cancelando las cuotas de la deuda.
Anhela darle sus hijos el apoyo necesario para que tengan acceso a una educación superior.
texts.en:
Martha enjoys her family, which includes her husband and 2 children aged 7 and 2.  She does not receive financial assistance from outside the country.  She works cultivating staple grains (corn and beans).  She learned how to do this from her parents, and she carries out this work with her husband and some hired workers. 

With this loan, she will buy agricultural supplies and pay for labor.  She will buy fertilizers, pesticides, and insecticides so that she can have an abundant harvest and produce better quality crops.  She is hoping to increase her sales and generate more income so that she can she can pay off her debt.  Martha aspires to give her children the support they need so that they can obtain a college education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for farmworkers

loans.name: Rosa Hermita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es chofer y comerciante.
Doña Rosa con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatos  de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella también le da parte del crédito a su esposo para que este lo emplee en su negocio pues él se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, el en su carro recorre vendiendo sus productos por la ciudad y los campos donde tiene muchos clientes. Ella lleva 9 años con su negocio con el cual se ayuda para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: ropa, zapatos, frutas y legumbres. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos financia mejor su negocio. Sus sueños son es tener buena salud ya que esta por operarse.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the "Tosagua" loan group meets every fifteen days. This city is known for being very active. Most of the inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry. It is also known for its vast greenery. 

Rosa lives in this city. She is fifty-eight years old. She is married, and from this relationship, she has four children who are now older. Her husband is a driver and trader. 

Rosa works in trade with the goal of earning something on her own to get ahead and helping her husband cover living expenses. She sells all types of clothing and shoes. She sells door-to-door, and she also sells at home to her better known customers. She will also give part of her loan to her husband so that he could use it for his business. He sells fruits and legumes. He drives throughout the city and country, where he has many customers, selling his products. She has nine years with this business and it helps her to get ahead. 

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as clothing, shoes, fruits, and legumes. She has been with the loan group since its beginning, and she likes it because the loans better fund her business. Her dream is to be of good health since she is about have an operation.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, fruits, and legumes.

loans.name: Danis Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Danis Rafael  de 30  años de edad es casado, tiene dos hijos  que dependen de él, sus hijos tienen edades de 05 y 03 años, vive en una comunidad de Choluteca, al sur de Honduras.
Don Danis Rafael  vive en casa de sus suegros  y se dedica desde hace 04  años  a la venta de dulces y galletas por mayor y al detalle distribuye a las pulperías y personas que se dedican a este tipo de negocio y en la época de escolar sus clientes son las escuelas y centros básicos.
Don Danis Rafael es una persona trabajadora que se levanta temprano a vender sus productos en su motocicleta, el tiene una pequeña bodega en donde almacena el producto.
Don Danis Rafael está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de bombones, confites, chocolates, galletas, etc. ya que quiere ampliar el negocio y surtirlo para esta época de navidad y desea aprovechar, con el apoyo de este préstamo el pretende mejorar sus ingresos.
Don Danis Rafael está muy agradecido con Prisma por el apoyo a su negocio ya que está creciendo y ahora el tiene más clientes, es su cuarto préstamo que solicita. 


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Danis Rafael, 30, is married and has two dependent children who are 5 and 3 years old. He lives in the community of Choluteca, in southern Honduras.

Danis Rafael lives in the home of his in-laws and has worked for 4 years by selling sweets and cookies wholesale and he individually distributes them to shops and individuals who do this type of work. During the school year, his customers include schools and general stores.

Danis Rafael is a hard-working person who wakes up early to sell his products on his motorcycle. He has a small shop where he sells his products.

Danis Rafael is requesting this loan to buy candy, sugar treats, chocolate, cookies, and more because he wants to grow his business and stock up for the Christmas season. He hopes to make the most of this time with the help of this loan to increase his income.

Danis Rafael is very grateful to Prisma for supporting his business because it is growing and he now has many customers. This is the fourth loan he is requesting.


San Lorenzo, Honduras – November 2013

loans.use: to buy candy, sugar treats, chocolate, cookies, and more for his business.

loans.name: Basam

texts.en:
Basam is a 24-year-old who lives in Taiz, Yemen.  He is a happy man who treats everyone well because of his opportunities to get ahead.  He works hard in a store, with a low salary, to offer a good life for his family.

Most of the money he makes is spent on raising his family.  His house is very old and needs a quick renovation.  The house is vulnerable to collapse at any time. He knows that such a thing costs a lot of money.  He has started renovating his house but is now short of money.  He needs to complete the renovation task, so he asked for a loan of 100,000 YER to buy construction supplies.  He hopes that after the completion of his house renovation he will feel safe in his house with his family.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to complete the task of his home renovation.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz, a 51-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, four sons and four daughters. One son and three daughters are studying and her husband is an auto mechanic.  His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs.  So, Shehnaz is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes.  She herself is a tailor and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future.  Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future.  She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To pay for a sewing machine.

loans.name: Regalada

texts.en:
Regalada is 63-years-old and married with three children.

Regalada works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Regalada has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Regalada aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Estela Ramona

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Estela, tiene 46 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos, cuatro mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 13 años que estudian en colegio. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Estela como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su negocio, él se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno y porcino, para lo cual se desplaza hasta los campos aledaños donde compra el ganado el mismo que luego lo transporta a los centros de faenamiento en la localidad, ahí vende las vacas y cerdos  a los comerciantes en estos lugares, el realiza esto tres a cuatro días por semana ya que también lleva las vacas hasta la ciudad de Bahía de Caraquez dos veces a la semana.
Este crédito es para comprar ganado y cerdos. Lleva 4 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos les ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son comprar un camión más grande para que su esposo realice su actividad comercial.
texts.en: In the city of Tosagua, every fifteen day the Grupo De Crédito Tosagua meets. This location is known as very dynamic where the majority of the inhabitants make their living in agriculture and the raising of livestock, and it's known as a zone with a lot of vegetation. Estela, who is 46 years old, lives in this location and maintains a common law marriage from which she has six kids. Four of her kids are adults, and the two who are 17 and 13 attend school. Her husband is a businessman. Estela as an approving wife is carrying out the loan so that her husband can use it in his business. He works in the purchase and sale of cattle and pigs. He travels to the neighboring countryside where he buys the livestock, the same that he then transports to slaughterhouses in the area. There he sells the cows and pigs to the businessmen in those places, he does this 3 to 4 days a week, and he takes the cows to the city of Bahía de Caraquez twice a week. This loan is to buy cattle and pigs. She has been in the Grupo De Crédito four years, and she likes it because the loans help them a lot. Their dream is to buy a bigger truck to help her husband achieve his commercial activity.

loans.use: to buy cattle and pigs.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Meet Godfrey: a resident of Kisii, he is married and has 3 children, all of whom are of school-going age. He has been doing farming for 6 years, where he produces and sells milk, eggs and bananas. He said that he enjoys planting napier grass for his dairy cattle.

Godfrey chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer good services at the client's doorstep and their loans are at a low interest rate.During the training offered by the finance officers, he learned how to develop a lifestyle of saving and why should one save. This loan will enable him to buy a dairy cow which will boost milk production. This will help him educate his children with ease, they will have fresh milk, and the increase in income will improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kanha

texts.en:
Kanha is 23 years old and single. She lives with her parents and siblings, in Prey Veng province. In this new academic year, she is a year-three student. She is majoring in accounting, at a local institute. At the same time, Kanha works as a cashier, employed by the same institute at which she is studying. This job provides the income that covers Kanha's tuition and other educational costs.

Due to a shortage of money, Kanha would like to borrow a Khmer student loan from HKL. She will use the loan to pay her tuition fees, and to buy workbooks and other study materials to support her course work. Kanha is grateful that the support of Kiva lenders will allow her to cover the cost of educational fees, and thus obtain her professional degree. After graduation, Kanha will be able to continue striving to fulfill her great ambition: to be a successful professional accountant and support her family. Kanha was photographed with her mother, standing next to their piggeries.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees, and to buy workbooks and other study materials to support her course work.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира прекрасная женщина с прекрасными мыслями. Она родилась в 1969 году. Гулмира замужем и имеет 2 детей, дочь и сына. Она всегда старалась для благо получения своей семьи. Ее муж занимается скотоводством. Гулмира хочет открыть новый бизнес. Она планирует открыть швейный цех. Гулмира обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она будет открывать швейный цех в центре своего района. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 9000 сомони для покупки 4 швейных машинок и два стола для кройки. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется, что ее бизнес будет только процветать.
texts.en: Gulmira is a lovely woman who has wonderful ideas. She was born in 1969 and has two children, a daughter and son. She has always worked hard for the benefit of her family. Her husband raises farm animals,  and she wants to start a new business. She plans to open a sewing shop. She took the course "Achieve Success," which was organized by the Association of Business Women. She will open her store in the center of her district. She requests a loan of 9,000 somoni to buy 4 sewing machines and 2 cutting tables. She awaits your kindness and hopes that her business will simply flourish.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and cutting tables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a water tank.

loans.name: Verline

texts.en:
Verline is married, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Verline is 41 years old, and all three children are in school.

Verline has a general store business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Verline has been in this business for six years. In the future, Verline would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jameelan

texts.en:
Jameelan is a 32-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Jameelan makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva, a sus 40 años de edad, es una madre cabeza de hogar que vela por el bienestar de su hijo adolescente de 15 años, a quien ha sacado adelante con su esfuerzo y dedicación. Durante su vida productiva siempre trabajó como empleada en diferentes actividades pero, con el propósito de mejorar sus ingresos y poder estar más tiempo con su hijo, decidió independizarse y montar su propio negocio, un restaurante de comidas rápidas que inició hace aproximadamente 8 meses, trabaja todos los días de 12 a 10 pm y cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado directo; el establecimiento ha tenido muy buena acogida en el sector y le ha generado buenos ingresos para solventar las necesidades del hogar.
El crédito que solicita es para realizar unas adecuaciones locativas (modificar la cocina), comprar utensilios de cocina y surtido al por mayor (panes, carnes frías, salsas, harina, gaseosas, aceite, productos desechables, entre otros), esto le permitirá cumplir con las normas de higiene exigidas por las autoridades de control de sanidad, además continuará ofreciendo sus productos y mejorará el margen de ganancia.
Genoveva solo desea seguir luchando para fortalecer y posicionar su negocio en el mercado, que le genere mayor rentabilidad y en un futuro, estar en la capacidad de adquirir una casa propia, en la que pueda disfrutar mejores condiciones de vida en compañía de su hijo.
texts.en:
At age 40, Genoveva is the head of her household. She takes care of her 15 year old son for whom she has strived to provide a good life through her hard work and dedication. 

From the time she was able to work, she has always worked as an employee at various jobs, but in order to improve her income and to be able to spend more time with her son, she decided to start her own business - a fast-food restaurant. She started her business about 8 months ago. She works every day from 12 pm to 10 pm with the help of one employee. The restaurant has been very well received in the neighbourhood and it has generated a good income to cover her household expenses. 

She is requesting the loan to do some renovations (to modify the kitchen), to buy kitchen utensils and wholesale supplies (breads, deli meats, sauces, flour, soft drinks, oil, disposable items, etc.). This will enable her to meet the board of food safety's hygiene standards. It will also allow her to continue to offer her products and improve her profit margin. 

Genoveva wants to continue her efforts to establish her business' position in the market, so that it can become more profitable. In the future, she hopes to buy a house and improve her and her son's standard of living.

loans.use: To do some renovations (to modify the kitchen), to buy kitchen utensils and wholesale supplies (breads, deli meats, sauces, flour, soft drinks, oil, disposable items, etc.).

loans.name: Arevshat

texts.en:
Arevhsat is a hairdresser with two years of experience. After coming back from the army two years ago, he has decided to earn his living by providing hairdresser service. Arevshat rents a small place in one of the village beauty salons and provides hairdressing service for locals. He lives together with his 17-years-old sister alone. As the only breadwinner of the family, he feels very responsible in providing a better life for his little sister. 

Customers value the service that Arevshat provides and prefer to come to Arevshat. He is very nice and attentive to his clients and that's the reason he gains their love and respect. Arevshat now asking for this loan to be able to purchase tools (chair, table, and hairdressing materials) needed for his work. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be great support to this young hairdresser and he hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for tools (chair, table, and materials) for providing hairdresser service

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is a 23-year-old, vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR with Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 7th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Reshman

texts.en: Reshman is a married woman and the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Reshman’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional status. For this reason, Reshman has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation service to his passengers. Reshman is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Reeta

texts.en:
Reeta is age 30; she is living with her two children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been selling fruits for many years; he sells seasonal fresh fruits from his shop in his hometown. The people like to buy fruits from him because he demands a very reasonable price for the fruits. Due to those suitable prices, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for fruits has increased and by noon his stock has sold.

Reeta feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for his family. She is taking out a loan for her husband so that he might be able to buy fruits in more quantity for equilibrium. 

Reeta wants to save the excess profits so she can utilize those savings for any future sudden or unexpected needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy fruits for her husband's fruit shop.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en: Hameedan is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been stitching clothes for the past two years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. She hopes to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. Hameedan is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 30 years old and has four children.  She is married, and three children are in school.

Mary Jane is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Jane has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sadbaroi

texts.en:
Sadbaroi is a purposeful woman with a great desire to progress in life. She is married and has four children. 

She is one of the successful businesswomen in her town. More than 13 years, she has been busy with a retail business; she sells fabric. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills help her to develop business, and in this way, to improve her living conditions. She manages the business alone. 

She wants to develop her business further, but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy.

This is her 18th loan from IMON, and she has a good credit story. 

She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy home fabrics for increase inventory. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy home fabrics for increase inventory.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 54-year-old widow with two kids, ages 17 and 19 years. She runs a retail shop, and she has been in business for 16 years. Right now her monthly income from the business is KES.40,000. 

She is borrowing a loan of KES. 60,000, which she intends to boost her business by buying two bags of sugar, cooking fat, cereals, and charcoal. 

She will use the anticipated profit from the business to pay school fees for her children and to start a poultry project. 

This is her second loan, and she successfully paid her previous loan. 

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children, buy a car, and help orphans by building an orphanage.

loans.use: To add stock to her shop.

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet is a hardworking and enterprising man who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya.

For the past three years, he has been selling cows and milk at the market to the general public. The main challenge for his business has been unstable market prices. 

He joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. He is requesting a loan of  40,000 KES to purchase cattle feed and a milking can for his business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle feed and a milking can for his business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy bales of clothes for resale. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson appreciates his previous Kiva loan, which improved his living standards. He is requesting a new loan of 10,000 KES to purchase more bundles of clothing for resale. His previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income. He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of clothing for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cassava, potatoes, and plantains for her business.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community, and has two years of experience in this field. Her husband assists her by purchasing goods from the market since he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She is the mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. With the loan she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Naseem wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open a metal shop and buy apparatus

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fashion slippers for her business

loans.name: Serob

texts.en:
Serob is 34-years-old. He is a furniture maker with three years of experience working in that field. He is well known among locals as a good quality furniture maker and his works are demanded among customers.

Serob is married and has a little daughter (1-year-old). As the only breadwinner of the family, Serob works hard to collect a high income and cover the family's basic costs.

Serob isn't able to complete the many current orders because he does not have enough materials. Therefore, Serob has applied for this loan. The loan will be used to purchase materials for making furniture and completing orders from his customers.

Serob has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions for informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The loan will be a huge support for Serob and his furniture making business and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for materials for furniture making

loans.name: Narek

texts.en:
Narek is a young auto repairman from the town of Yeghegnadzor. He lives with his parents and 5-year-old, little brother. 

Narek is an enthusiastic and hardworking worker. He provides auto repair services from a small rented garage in the center of the city of Yeghegnadzor. The income that he earns from this activity helps him cover his family's daily costs and help his parents in sustaining the family. Narek is now asking for this loan to be able to purchase equipment that he needs in his work. That purchase will give Narek an opportunity to provide better service to his clients and the work will be more effective.

Narek has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is important for Narek and he will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for equipment to provide auto repair services

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is 31 years old and the mother of five children. For 10 years, Shamim has been running a business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family at a point in time when her husband was the only breadwinner. With the passage of time, her sales increased and so did her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. She also deals in animal sales and purchases on a seasonal basis. Because of her work, Shamim is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Vepkhia

texts.en:
Vepkhia is 33 years old. He lives in the village of Kvitiri, West Georgia with his wife, two children and his in-laws. The family is involved in a small-scale agricultural business: they run a family-owned dairy farm with one milk cow and they breed five pigs. The family produces cheese and sells it in the village. Vepkhia even sells piglets seasonally, but the income is not enough to provide the family with adequate living conditions.

Vepkhia has requested a loan from Credo to start a poultry business. His loan request was approved as part of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. With the credit amount, Vepkhia will purchase chickens and place them in a shed located in their yard. He will raise and sell the chickens for a higher price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy chickens and start a poultry farm

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling bamboo in the Philippines; she has been in this business for 12 years now.

Vilma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to sell to her customers.

Vilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to sell to her customers

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

Visitacion has been in this business for five years; she earns more income from buying and selling piglets.

Visitacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 48-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, two daughters, and five sons in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Since 2008, her husband has had a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. His wife Tasleem has requested a loan from KIVA's partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods for his general store, to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Tasleem and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: buy a variety of goods for her husband's general store

loans.name: Yuniah

texts.en:
Yuniah is a farmer living in the Nyamira area. She is married and has three children, all of school-going age.

She has practiced farming for five years, where she produces and sells tea and vegetables. 

Like most farmers in Nyamira, Yuniah loves tea farming because it has greater returns as people can't do without tea and so the market is very high and production is also high.The major challenge with tea farming is lack of rain (because tea has to have rain all year round) and lack of sufficient funds.

Yuniah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer their loans at a low interest rate.

This loan will help her generate more income and hence improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva, age 27, is from the Dmanisi district. He is single and lives with his mother, brother, sister-in-law, and two nephews.

Shalva is a farmer and breeds one milk cow and ten piglets. He makes cheese to sell, as well as for his family to consume. His earnings are hardly enough to cover food and household costs and the family lives in poverty. The local government assists the family financially as they belong to the “vulnerable poor” category.

In order to generate income, Shalva plans to start a business trading fruits and vegetables. With this loan, he will purchase fresh products in bulk and sell them on the local open market with a price mark-up. Shalva hopes his initiative will be lucrative and he will be able to increase his family's funds. Shalva and his family members are waiting for your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Korkrie Group

texts.en:
For the second time, Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you once again, the “Korkrie” group. Members of the Korkrie group have just finished repaying their last Kiva loan very successfully, and are again requesting a new loan of 600,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in the group. With the help of this new loan, they are again further empowered to boost their respective business inventories. 

Mohamed remains the featured leader of this group.  Mohamed is going to use his loan this time to buy cosmetics in large scale to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in large scale to add to his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, pepper, salt, onion, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 32 years old. He lives in Stepanavan city in Lori region. Armen is married and the father of two very pretty children. For several years Armen had to go to the Russian Federation, and he did there different constructional works in order to provide his family with minimum living conditions. 

Fortunately these difficulties now are in past, and it is already four years that Armen is running his business. He has a small shop of his own where he sells fruits and vegetables, which he buys from the villagers of his region (apples, pears, plums, pineapples, bananas, oranges, kiwi, persimmons, and mandarins, also some vegetables like potatoes, cucumbers, greens, broccoli, tomatoes, etc.). 

His wife helps him very much; she works there as a saleswoman. Their shop is very popular because of great assortment and low prices. 

The citrus fruits he brings from Georgia once in two weeks on a rented car. As he says, the expanses on the way to Georgia are a lot, and he greatly wants to buy a car. 

So he is asking a loan of AMD 800,000, which together with his saved money will be enough to buy a car and cut his expenses and increase income from his business more.

loans.use: to buy a car and cut his business expenses  and increase income from his business

loans.name: Al-Rabia'a Group

texts.en:
Al-Rabia'a is a three–member female group from Aden, Yemen.  

In this loan, they applied for 150,000 YER from AMB.

Nasreen is a very active woman, and she sells different items like rechargeable phone cards. She works every day, and she is able to make a fair daily profit. She started her business by selling clothes to her neighbours, then she expanded her business to sell products like phone cards around the area. 

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Yemen Rial (YER) from AMB to buy rechargeable phone cards for her business. 

She hopes she can use the profit she will make to improve her family's living standards. She thanks Kiva lenders for financing her first loan.

loans.use: to buy rechargeable phone cards for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, leaves, etc., helping her prepare more of her tasty ‘kenkey’

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 28 years old and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a hard-working and very honorable man, always committed to getting ahead.

All his life he has been working hard and earning money to assist his family. He is a kind man who works as an employer in the electricity foundation making a low salary.  He intends to buy home appliances for his house, but the amount he has is not enough to buy what he needs. 

So, he is requesting a loan from AMB to buy home appliances and furniture to use in his house. He dreams of studying for a Master's degree in his specialization and improving his living standards.

loans.use: to buy home appliances and furniture to use in his house.

loans.name: Max

texts.en:
Max is a 28-year-old man. He is a businessman with a retail shop in a rural area in Nsasi, in the Ibanda district. 

He has been involved in this business since 2005 in the small center of the town of Nsasi. Max has been able to raise income from his shop and support his family. His customers are the fellow villagers.

He has a dream to own a big shop in the near future and build his own shop since he rents the place where he currently operates his business from.
He therefore wants a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy retail stock to expand his shop. His main challenges are competition and price fluctuations.

loans.use: to buy retail stock

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is 35 years old and a housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four sons and a daughter. Her husband has owned a hotel for 15 years, which is the only source of income for their family. 

Bushra has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase materials like flour, rice, pulses, vegetables, etc.

She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them and will bring a positive change to their monthly income.

loans.use: to pay for purchase materials like flour, rice, and pulses (grain legumes) for the hotel

loans.name: Willayat

texts.en:
Willayat is a 34-year-old hard working housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, two sons, and one daughter. 

Her husband is a security guard by profession, but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore, for the past four years, along with his profession of security guard, he also drives a taxi at night. 

Currently, he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. 

Willayat has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the amount of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi. 

With the profit, her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in the future. She desires to provide a quality education to all her children, and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. 

She is very thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: To pay for taxi repair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish.

loans.name: Emardin

texts.en: Emardin appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her farming business and earn a higher income. She is now requesting a loan of KSH 40,000 to purchase more seeds and fertilizers . She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Khariton

texts.en:
Khariton is a young and rather successful businessman who lives with his family in the city of Sevan in Gegharkunik region. This will be Khariton's third loan from Kiva and its field partner, Nor Horizon. 

He is still running his own business; he has a wholesale grocery trade from his warehouse to other grocery stores. He is already a very skilled and clever businessman, and now he has a lot of new partners who bring him big orders, which promises a decent income for his family.

Khariton asks a loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams to buy a lot sweets, coffee, and drinks before the New Year's holidays, since he knows that this period of the year is very profitable and active for his business.

loans.use:
to buy a lot of sweets, coffee, and drinks 
.

loans.name: Al Zahra Al Baydaa Group

texts.en:
Fatima is the featured borrower of the Al Zahra Al Baydaa group.  She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua since they are all working hard to develop both their businesses and their family's living.

Fatima is the first lady lady from the right; she is a 55-year-old married mother of six children.  She has been working 23 years selling clothes, 15 years in the housekeeping business, and 12 years raising cows. She runs these three businesses at the same time to make sure that she can provide her family with the necessary living needs. Since their needs are increasing, she has to run more than one business to cover their needs.

Fatima's is willing to keep on increasing her family's income, so her acquired loan will be invested in buying a cow which will help her a lot in her business development and increase her income to make sure that all of her family's needs are met.

As for the other group members, Hamida is at the center, and Hiba is the first from the left.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase drinks, pure water, milk, cigarettes, and batteries to expand her  business.

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en:
Khachatur is a 44-year-old married man who lives in Ninotsminda. He has a pensioner father, a wife, and a daughter. His wife works as a milkmaid and generates 250 GEL per month. The family owns one milking cow whose products are sold locally. They also have a plot of agricultural land, where they cultivate potatoes for trading. 

In order to more effectively meet all of his family's needs, Khachatur plans to purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables and start a wide retail business in Ninotsminda. His requested loan of $3,000 USD was approved by the start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This new business will help Khachatur's family to live in financially stable conditions. Khachatur relies on the good will of the lenders.

loans.use: To start a trading business with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ivliane

texts.en:
Ivliane is a 64-year-old married man. He lives in a small village in the Senaki district with his wife and son. Ivliane is involved in agricultural activities. He has a cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. His wife milks the cow every day and produces cheese to sell. In addition, Ivliane has a plot of land where nut trees are grown. The family sells the harvested nuts locally. 

Ivliane decided to start a taxi business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $1,500 for purchasing a used car. Once the car is purchased, he will serve local people as a taxi driver and will increase his income. With the increase in income, he will be able to improve his family's living conditions. Ivliane awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase a used car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Dritan

texts.en:
Dritan is a 32-year-old hardworking man who wants to buy a dairy cow and also build a greenhouse with this loan. The amount that he is requesting to achieve this goal is 250,000 Albanian Lek and this will mark his first loan with VisionFund Albania.

Dritan is married and has two children, who are ten and two years old. When Dritan was 22, he started his own agricultural/livestock business. Here is what he said: “With a bit of difficulties in the beginning, I have been doing okay so far. Finding clients to sell the raw milk or the veggies, it was not difficult, because you take the products and go to the local farmers market of our nearby city and of course, you stay there all day until you sell all, or at least most, of the produce. We are with my wife in this activity; otherwise by myself would have been almost impossible.”

Dritan has been photographed in front of his house and with an agricultural type of vehicle that he’s been using in his work.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, salt, onion, and vita to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dry and fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula, es casada, tiene una familia compuesta por su esposo y dos hijos de 5 y 4 años de edad, es casada, debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos extras para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar, ha puesto en práctica un oficio que aprendió de de sus padres, como es la venta de tortillas, la cual atiende sola, la atiende de 4:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema en atender su negocio.
Con la inversión comprara una plancha, para aumentar su producción, con lo que espera atender mejor a los clientes, atraer nuevos clientes y mejorar su economía, para cancelar la deuda y tener mayor la oportunidad de seguir apoyando a su familia.
Sueña con tener los recursos económicos necesarios para ofrecer a sus hijos una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Paula is married and her family consists of her husband and two children who are 5 and 4 years old. Because her family has a need for her to earn extra income to support her husband with household expenses, she has set up a trade which she learned from her parents, which is the sale of tortillas. She attends to the business by herself from 4:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. As of yet she has not had any problems running her business. 

With the loan she will purchase a tortilla press to increase her production. She hopes that this will enable her to better attend to her clients, attract new clients, and increase her income. Increasing her income will help her pay off her loan and give her a greater opportunity to continue supporting her family. She dreams of having the financial resources to offer her children a university education.

loans.use: to purchase a tortilla press.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a new client who is 50 years old. He is a married man with eight children and he applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy organic fertilizers to improve the quality of his coffee plantation. He has a challenge of little income to purchase manure and more products in order to generate income and take their children to school.
In the photograph is the Ugafode (staff, left), Eric, and his wife.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Ashirafu

texts.en:
Ashrafu is a new customer, age 35, married with two children. 

He deals with onions, and he applied for a loan of UGX.2,000,000 to improve his farming business. 

He has a challenge of low business turnover from his commercial farming, and low market prices, so he decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to invest in man power/labor and to expand both his farmland and agricultural products.

In the photograph, the client is on the left and the Ugafode credit officer is on the right.

loans.use: To hire man power/labor to till the farm

loans.name: Mercedes Zoila

texts.es: Mercedes de 47 años de edad habita en casa propia junto su esposo y sus dos hijos de 15 años y 13 años de edad. Para Mercedes y su esposo lo más importante es que sus hijos estudien y cuenten con las mejores condiciones de vida. Tiene una pequeña tienda que con mucho esfuerzo logró establecer en su lugar de residencia. Además, también se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales (preparación alimenticia a base de masa de maíz y verduras). Es conocida como una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y responsable. Mercedes desea encementar el piso de la vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra y desea darles condiciones más higiénicas  a sus hijos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para dar inicio a la reparación del piso.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 47 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children who are 15 and 13 years old. The most important thing for Mercedes and her husband is that their children study and that they have the best living conditions possible. 

They have a small store which they established out of their home through great effort. They also prepare and sell tamales (a food prepared with cornmeal and vegetables). Mercedes is known as a hard-working, entrepreneurial and responsible woman. 

The floor of her home is currently made of earth, and she hopes to lay a cement floor in order to create a more hygienic living condition for her children. For that reason she requests this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand and gravel and to begin repairing the floor.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and gravel to begin repairing the floor of her home.

loans.name: Evilen Andrea

texts.es:
Evilen es una joven emprendedora de 20 años de edad, debido a la falta de experiencia laboral le ha sido difícil emplearse, motivo por el cual decidió comenzar a vender productos por catálogo, sus principales clientes son familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector donde reside, el oficio lo aprendió de una amiga que realiza la misma actividad y, así ha generado ingresos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y el sustento diario de su hijo de 2 años.
El apoyo del crédito lo solicita para comprar surtido de mercancía (perfumería, cremas corporales y faciales, cosméticos, accesorios, entre otros), así aprovechará las promociones y podrá adquirir los productos a menor costo, logrando obtener un mejor nivel de ganancia a la hora de venderlos, esto le permitirá tener más variedad para ofrecer y satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de su clientela.
Evilen toma esta labor como un paso hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño, montar su propio almacén en el que pueda vender mayor cantidad de artículos y prendas de vestir, garantizando una mayor rentabilidad que le brinde la capacidad para disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida y dar a su hijo la posibilidad de tener un futuro más prometedor y exitoso.
texts.en:
Evilen is an enterprising young woman of 20 years of age. Due to her lack of work experience it has been difficult for her to find work, which is why she decided to start selling products via catalogue. Her main clients are relatives, friends, and neighbours. She learnt the trade from her friend who does the same work and, in this way, has generated sufficient income to support her husband with the household’s financial burden and provide for her 2-year-old son.

She is requesting the support of the loan so she can purchase merchandise (perfume, body creams, facial creams, cosmetics, accessories, etc.). She will take advantage of special offers and acquire the products at a lesser cost so she can obtain a greater profit when she sells them. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and satisfy the needs and tastes of her clientele.

Evilen is doing this work as a step towards fulfilling her main dream of setting up her own store, in which she can sell a greater quantity of items and garments, thereby guaranteeing greater profits and giving her the ability to enjoy a better quality of life and give her son the possibility of having a more promising and successful future.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (perfumes, body creams, facial creams, cosmetics, accessories, etc.)

loans.name: Juan Ernesto

texts.es:
Juan, opta por un nuevo crédito para aumentar su producción y recolectar la cosecha de maíz, frijol y maicillo, por lo que comprará fertilizantes, insecticidas, abono y plaguicidas, ya que son necesarios para preparar la tierra y luego sembrarla.
Con el préstamo anterior adquirió los insumos necesarios para cultivar granos básicos de mucha calidad, sus ingresos mejoraron y su familia hoy cuenta con una mejor alimentación, salud y vestuario.
texts.en:
Juan has decided to take out a new loan to increase his production and to harvest his crop of corn, beans and sorghum. To this end he will purchase fertilizers, insecticides, compost and pesticides which are necessary to prepare and later plant his land. 

He used his previous loan to acquire the supplies necessary for cultivating high quality basic grains. His income improved and his family now counts on improved nourishment, health and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, compost and pesticide.

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en: Margarit lives in Mayisyan village in the Armavir region of Armenia.  She lives there with her grandfather, father and brother. Margarit studies at a local university in the economic department. Her father and brother work hard to be able to cover the family's daily costs and it is very difficult for them to save money for Margarit's education. As a result, Margarit has applied for this loan to pay for her university tuition and continue her studies there. She will be very grateful to lenders for support and for the opportunity to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, which will allow her to sell greater quantities of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Sulltane

texts.en:
Sulltane has been photographed here with her 28-year-old son, Erion, and her grandson. Sulltane’s husband passed away a few months back and since then she has been living with her son and his family. She is very grateful that she is not alone, according to her.

For five years, Sulltane has been in the livestock business and has been selling raw milk from her cows to a local dairy farm. Before starting her business, she worked as a milker at a nearby stable. Sulltane is requesting a loan to buy fodder for her animals. This won’t be her first time applying for a loan through the same institution and, as such, she has proved to be very reliable.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: she will buy more rice, pepper, oil, fish, meat, etc for her local restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous
