loans.use: to purchase more body cream, powder, and soap for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking seasoning and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Jasobala

texts.en:
Jasobala, a 36-year-old housewife, lives in the small village of Maynaguri with her husband, Ratan. They are blessed with three children, all students and one of them has had already passed the Madhyamik [10th standard] examination. Jasobala has completed Class VI (Grade 6); her husband is illiterate and can sign his name only. She is a homemaker and her husband is a cycle van puller. Her husband rents a van from a local owner and is not able to make sufficient income. They are very much concerned about their children's proper education and about earning their livelihood.

Now Jasobala is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to purchase their own van to start their own business. This will enable them to keep all profits and improve the family's future. Demand for vans is high in their rural area for transporting rice, vegetables and other goods to the market. The high volume of work will create a steady income so that Jasobala can give her children a bright future. She is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van to start her own business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento por el apoyo brindado, él continua con la actividad de la ganadería y a la agricultura, él pertenece al banco comunal “El Balcon” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono.

Juan tiene 44 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene ocho hijos, él es una persona trabajadora que nació en el distrito de Challabamba pero vive en la comunidad de Majopata anexo de la comunidad de Carnicero. (La comunidad de Majopata está ubicada en el distrito del Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Juan is grateful to the lenders for this loan and he is happy for the support.  He is continuing his  farming and livestock raising activity.  He is a member of the "El Balcon" communal bank and needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

Juan is 44 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has eight children.  He is a hardworking person and was born in the Challabamba district, but lives in the Majopata annex to the Carnicero community. (The Majopata community is located in the Challabamba district of the Paucartambo province, within the Cusco department of Peru.)

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Chrysantus

texts.en:
Chrysantus is married with three children and lives in a four bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced so many challenges in life, death of his only brother who was very supportive to him and the family at large, his wife had a birth complication which almost took her life and led to expenses on medication which almost led to the collapse of his business, his child refused to go to school and preferred strolling around the quarter during school hours and he has also had to deal with theft of his property.

He has taken and successfully repaid his loan eleven times and says with this new loan requested, he will repair his public transportation car. He will buy tires, pay for labor, do general repairs on the car, pay for the required documents that will allow the car to be operated in town and also buy other parts needed for maintenance. He has a positive view of business, succeeding because he has been doing it for a long time. With this business activity, the community members will be transported to and from their job sites, their farm produces will be transported to the market, and children will be transported to and from school.

With the profit from this loan, he will improve his family's standard of living by providing them with three meals, pay for his family's medication, pay for his childrens' education, provide them with other basic necessities. He will also put back some profits into the business and do repairs on his house. He prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to buy motor parts, pay for his books

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
She is single with one child and lives in a two bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges In life among which are, inadequate capital to carry out her business, death of her brother, sister and father who were of great support to her, also the sickness of her child that required her to spend almost all of her capital on medication and hospital bills and other family problems.

She has taken and successfully repaid her loans seven times and says with this new loan requested, she will expand her restaurant and bar business by buying more crates, drinks, cocoyam’s, palm oil, beans, rice and vegetable oil. She holds a positive view of her business succeeding because of longevity in the business. She has regular customers who drink and eat at her bar, she supply drinks in her community on occasions and she has a good business location. With this business activity, the community will have regular supply of drinks and food and at moderate prices; credit facilities will be offered to regular and trust worthy customers, and people in the community will not go to long distances to buy food and drinks.

With the profit from this loan, she will educate her children by providing them with the necessities needed in school, put back some profits in her business for expansion, provide for her family's medication, take care of other family members and also save for future expansion. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates; because members are educated before loan disbursement and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy drinks, cocoyam’s, palm oil, beans, rice and vegetable oil

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married and has five school going children.She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the last three years, selling at the market to her neighbors’ and passersby.She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil,and firewood for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business

loans.name: Agja

texts.en: Agja is a 69-year-old woman who lives in a village called Kulari in the Marneuli district of Georgia. She lives with her pensioner husband and son. Agja's son works as an artisan and earns approximately 400 Georgian Lari (GEL) monthly. The family also runs agricultural activities. They have land where they grow different kinds of vegetables for family use and also to sell. The family decided to expand their agribusiness and has requested a loan to purchase a milk cow.  The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program and her loan request is for 1,000 GEL.  After the cow is purchased, the family will start producing dairy products like cheese and yogurt for sale. They will also use the milk products for family consumption. The new business initiative will give Agja a chance to have financial stability and an increased monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows and sell dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional pepper, rice, maggi cube, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items including pepper, oil, rice, eggs, and soap for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Nji Christinia

texts.en:
She is married with six children and lives in a six bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life among which are, inadequate capital to successfully carry out her business, failure in her business due to wrong management, death of her close family members, friends and other relatives who have been of great support to her, sickness in her family and ignorance, school drugs is also a problem in their family .
She has taken and repaid her loans successfully six times and says with this new loan requested, she will expand her provision store by buying more sweets, biscuits, detergents, bread, chocolate, milk etc, and also buy farm seedlings like maize, beans, cocoyam’s and yams. She holds positive view of her business succeeding because she has been doing the business for long, and as such has experience.  She has regular customers who buy from her store and she has a good business location. With this activity, the community will have regular supply of provisions at cheaper rates and the store is easily accessible.
With the profit from this loan, she will expand her business, provide her family with basic necessities and also cater for other family members. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy farm seedlings, palm oil mile, and provisions for her store

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru: Рахима целеустремленная женщина из отдаленного региона северного Таджикистана. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Рахима уже более 22 года занимается скотоводством. Она имеет хорошие условия для развития своего бизнеса. Рахима покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке. Рахима имеет дополнительный доход от выращивания сельхоз культур. Она является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса и не имеет свой собственный бизнес. Рахима хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и развевать бизнес. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Rahima, age 50, is an ambitious woman who lives in a remote region of northern Tajikistan.  She is married and raising four children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for more than 22 years.  She has all the necessary conditions to develop her business.  She buys livestock, which she fattens for a few months, and then resells her animals at the local market.

Rahima also makes an additional income from growing crops.  She is her family's main breadwinner.  Her husband helps her to run the business but he doesn't have his own business.

Rahima wants to increase her working capital and develop her business.  She is taking a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy some cattle.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
He is married with five children and lives in a three bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced so many problems in life among which are, inadequate capital to successfully carry out his business, death of his mother and father living him behind to cater for himself and siblings, school dropout, death of his child after spending so much money on medication, and sickness in his family.
He has taken and successfully repaid his loan three times and says with this new loan requested, he will expand his agricultural productivity by buying a sprayer which will be used for spraying insects on the crops, buying more seedlings, a wheelbarrow which will be used for transporting the seedlings to the farm and the farm output to the market, he will also engage in livestock rearing which will bring in additional income to his family. He holds a positive view of his business succeeding because of longevity in the business and experience, he has a good farming land, he plans to buy improved farm seedlings and he has a ready supply market. With this activity, the community will benefit from the surplus droppings from the livestock which will serve as fertilizer for their farms.
With the profit from this loan, he will buy more farmland, educate his children, and also buy more livestock. He prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy farm seedlings, livestock, sprayer and wheelbarrow

loans.name: Hashim

texts.en: Hashim is a thirty-nine-year-old married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy fish to sell. High license fees and lack of facilities for refrigeration are the challenges that he still faces. However, he intends to expand his business into new markets, based on the fact that fish is the main source of food in Bundibugyo and it is in high demand. Hashim is requesting the loan in order to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal bags to increase her sales even more.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama est une jeune femme de 29 ans marié et mère de deux enfants. Après sa formation, elle ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'elle gère depuis 7ans déjà. Elle a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, mèches, et greffes dans son institut parce qu'elle achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de son enfant, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future.
texts.en:
Mariama, age 29, is a young married woman and the mother of two children.  After completing her professional training, she opened a hairdressing salon, which she has now been managing for seven years already.  Her main challenge is that she often has to deal with a shortage of cosmetic products, because she can only buy her goods on a retail basis.  

Mariama's goal is to meet the needs of her customers while making large profits.  She is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy goods in bulk quantities, which will allow her to reach her goals.  With the profits from this loan, she will be able to meet her needs and those of her child, and she will also save some money to expand her activity in the future.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cosmetic products: hair extensions, hair weaves etc.

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali and her husband, Bipan, with their three children live in the small town of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri. She and her husband are both illiterate but know how to sign their names. Her children are studying in different classes. 

Dipali is a homemaker and her husband is associated with an agricultural business. Her husband’s income is not sufficient for their family, so Dipali decided to start her own business and help her husband financially. In her locality, the demand for milk is very high, so she decided to buy a cow to sell the milk in the market and make her family financially strong. Due to lack of money, she is unable to purchase a cow for starting her new business, so she applied for a loan from Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) and Kiva.

In the future, Dipali wants to build a large farmhouse and give higher education to her children by making a good profit from this business. She is very grateful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to sell milk in the market.

loans.name: Gaston

texts.fr: Gaston est  un jeune homme de 28 ans fiancé père d'un enfant. Après sa formation, il a ouvert un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis 13 ans déjà, il n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter des tissus et le petit matériel de coutures (épingles, aiguilles, doublure, fil...) qui l'évitera d'aller au marché tout le temps, elle pourra coudre et revendre à ses clients. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture pour agrandir son activité, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Gaston is a 28-year old man, in a relationship and the father of one child. After completing his training, he opened a small tailor shop, which has been running well for 13 years already. Gaston does not have enough supplies needed to process his orders more quickly and meet customer demand on time. This is why he is seeking a loan to buy fabric and sewing supplies (pins, needles, lining, thread, etc), which will spare him having to go to the market all the time. [He] will be able to keep sewing and selling to his customers. The revenues derived from this loan will allow him not only to buy sewing supplies and expand his business but also to provide for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: she will buy more cold water by sack to resell.

loans.name: Zvikomborero Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Ivy from Mutare. She is married with four children and three are attending school. She is also a member of Zvikomborero Group. 

Ivy runs a manufacturing business producing toilet detergents. The business has been in operation for three years. She says the main challenges faced are late payments from clients. Ivy has requested a loan of $400 to purchase raw materials for the manufacturing of toilet detergents. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve general family welfare. In the future, Ivy plans to own her own shop in the light industry field.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the manufacturing of toilet detergents in order to meet demand.

loans.name: Tornike

texts.en:
Tornike is 22 years old. He lives in the small town of Zhinvali with his wife and infant son. Tornike doesn’t have any kind of business. The only source of income for the family is his small monthly salary from the local sports department as he is a sportsman. His monthly wage is nearly $175, which is hardly enough for a young family.

Tornike requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a fast food business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of a lack of experience in this field. His loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to rural, vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the credit he receives, Tornike will purchase all the needed equipment and the stock of raw materials to make doner (kebab). He will start the café and hopes his business will be profitable as there is not a similar café nearby. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to start up a fast food cafe and sell doner (kebab).

loans.name: Adrianny Massiell

texts.es:
adrianny Massiell es una joven estudiante de mercadeo, ella solicita un préstamo para poder pagar sus estudios, esta es su historia: Soy Adrianny Massiell, tengo 21 años de edad y vivo en la zona Este de la ciudad de Santo Domingo con mi madre. Soy la más pequeña de tres hermanos; mi padre es taxista y mi madre ama de casa.
Hace pocos años mi madre sufrió de una grave enfermedad a mi padre lo atropellaron en y quedo con lesiones permanentes. Esto ha causado que los pocos ingresos que tenemos en su mayoría vayan destinado a la salud de ambos. 
Me gustaría ingresar en la carrera de Lic. En Mercadotecnia en la Universidad Apec, ya que me encanta el mundo empresarial; soy muy creativa, casual y esta carrera me permite aplicar todo eso que me caracteriza. 
Desde temprana edad me ha gustado estudiar, fui reconocida como estudiante durante mis años de bachiller y mis estudios de básica y quiero seguir desarrollándome y ser una buena profesional en el área. Quisiera aprovechar el programa de doble titulación que me ofrece la universidad y luego realizar alguna especialidad. Ayudar a mi familia a pagar el tratamiento de mis padres, y construirle una casa mejor a ambos.
La aprobación de este préstamo es de vital importancia para mí y mi familia porque sin el mismo sería imposible estudiar en esta Universidad que es considerada la mejor en el área de Mercadeo, ya que mi familia no me puede ayudar con los gastos porque los ingresos de mi padre como taxista no alcanzan para mantener un hogar de 5 miembros.
texts.en:
Adrianny Massiell is a young marketing student.  She's requesting a loan to be able to pay for her studies.  This is her story:

I'm Adrianny Massiell.  I'm 21 years old and I live in the eastern area of the city of Santo Domingo with my mother.  I'm the youngest of three siblings; my father's a taxi driver and my mother's a homemaker.

A few years ago my mother had a grave illness and my father was run over and left with permanent injuries.  This has meant that what little income we have has gone to their health.

I would like to enroll in the master's program in marketing in Universidad Apec because I love the business world.  I'm very creative and casual, and this profession allows me to apply everything that defines me.

I have liked to study from a young age.  I was known as a student in my high school and basic education years, and I want to continue to grow and become a good professional in the field.  I would like to make the most of the double degree program the university offers and then do a specialization.  I also want to help my family pay for my parents' treatments and build them both a better house.

The approval for this loan is of vital importance to me and my family because, without it, it would be impossible to study in this university, which is considered the best in the field of marketing.  My family can't help me with the expenses because my father's income as a taxi driver isn't enough to support a household of five people.

loans.use: to cover her education expenses

loans.name: Jacques Antoine

texts.fr: jacques est une homme de 39 ans marié père de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 04 et 19 ans. Il est commerçant et vend du poisson frais dans un marché de la capitale depuis 17 ans. c'est grâce à ça qu'ils'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter le poisson détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour lui. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de poisson, Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses bénéfices. Il réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfices dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Jacques is a 39-year old man, married and the father of three children ranging from four to 19 years of age. He is a vendor and has been selling fresh fish at one of the capital city's market for 17 years. Thanks to this work he is able to support his family.  Since he buys fish retail, he does not really have much of a margin left. This is why this loan is so important to him: it will allow him to increase his stock. This way he will  avoid having to make daily trips to buy fish and  will save on  taxi costs, which will also help with his revenues. He will reinvest part of his revenues in his business and use the rest to provide for his family.

loans.use: to stock up on crates of fish.

loans.name: Myagmardorj

texts.en:
Myagmardorj is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people for two years. His wife has the position of manager at the trade center. Their elder daughter goes to kindergarten. They live in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. 

Myagmardorj is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to rent a stall at the trade center and sell clothes for extra income. Starting a clothes sales business is important for him because his two daughters are growing each day and their needs are also increasing. He is a very hardworking individual who cares deeply for his family.

loans.use: to start a clothes sales business.

loans.name: Edra

texts.en:
Edra is an new customer aged 35 who is married with four children. He deals with clothes. He applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to improve his business. He has a challenge of little business turnover from his business and low market purchase, so he decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to buy more clothes to expand on the business and in turn increase his profits. Edra hopes his sales will be much more, this being a festive season.
In the photo is Edra (seated) with the UGAFODE staff.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur lives in the Muranga area of Central Kenya. He is married and has three children. He has practiced farming for 23 years. He produces and sells milk, tea, and a few crops. He loves farming as it acts as his main source of income, but his major challenge is brought about by insufficient funds.
Arthur chose Juhudi Kilimo to fund him and help him construct a dairy unit because they help small scale farmers to grow economically. During the training, he learned that microfinance institutions help farmers with small projects to grow. This loan will help him generate more income and thus provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a mother of three living in central Kenya. She practices daily farming for survival. She is widowed and has to take care of her family single-handedly. She works on the farm on weekdays. On Saturdays, she fetches water and collects firewood together with other women in her community. On Sundays she joins the community in worship in the local church. With this routine, she rarely has time to rest or socialize with her children.

With the mission of empowering women, VEP advanced her a loan of 100,000 KES for biogas construction that would save her a lot of time and energy spent collecting wood. This would give her a day off for herself and her family. With the biogas she would enjoy cooking without smoke and her pots would also be clean from soot.

Manure from her three cows will be enough to supply her with gas for cooking and lighting and the slurry will be helpful to grow her fodder and reduce purchases of fertilizers. The money saved and the income from the sale of milk will be used to repay the loan, and what remains would be used to grow her dairy farming business.

loans.use: to construct biogas.

loans.name: Delmer

texts.es: El señor Delmer tiene 23 años, está casado y tiene un hijo que depende de sus ingresos,  sus padres le donaron un terreno donde con su esfuerzo construyo una casa pero aun no realizo los trámites correspondientes para tener el derecho propietario. Tiene un grado de instrucción de nivel primario y se dedica a la producción de leche, con una antigüedad de 5 años en el rubro y 4 años como actividad propia. Debido a que sus ingresos no le alcanzan para cubrir todos los gastos, también se dedica al servicio de pintura y por las noches al servicio de guardia de seguridad. Actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de soya y forraje para su ganado lechero, de esta forma lograra incrementar su producción y  obtendrá mas ingresos para terminar de construir su casa y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Delmer is 23 years old, married, and has a dependent son.  His parents gave him some land and he built a house on it, but he was not able to make all the payments to be able to own it.  He has a first grade education and has been a milk producer for a total of five years, four of which has been on his own.  He is also a painter, since his income was not enough to cover all expenses, and by nights he works as a security guard.  He is asking for a loan so he can buy soy and hay for his dairy cows, so that he can increase his production and income that will allow him to finish building his house and get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, de 23 años, está casada con William y tiene una hija de 3 años; por el momento vive en la casa de suegra, lugar en el que comparte junto a su pareja la alegría de educar y criar a su hija. El trabajo de Elena consiste en la venta de productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos, aceite, además vende bebidas, golosinas, frutas y otros productos. Tiene un espacio en su casa destinado a esta actividad en donde atiende diariamente a sus clientes. Por la tardes instala su puesto de ventas al frente de la escuela de la zona en la que vive y ahí se encarga de trabajar durante el recreo hasta la hora de salida de los niños. Considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer bajo el inclemente sol que son intensas durante la tarde. Lleva en ésta actividad 7 años, trabaja sola mientras que su pareja trabaja en su mototaxi. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para realizar otras actividades, actualmente desea implementar una tienda mas amplia y con productos de calidad, espera pronto lograr su meta y continuar en la ruta del éxito y la prosperidad por el bien de su familia. En esta oportunidad solicitara  S/.600, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometida una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de abarrotes conformado por arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos y aceite, también comprará diversas golosinas, frutas y otros productos que consumen los niños, de esta forma espera mantener estable sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Elena, age 23, is married to William and has a three-year-old daughter. At the moment, she lives at her mother-in-law's house, a place where she and her partner are happy to raise and educate their daughter. Elena's work consists of selling food products such as rice, sugar, milk, eggs, oil, as well as beverages, snack foods, fruits, and other products. She has a space at home that is designated for her business and for attending to her customers on a daily basis. In the afternoons, she sets up a vending stand in front of the school in the area where she lives. She works at her stand during recess and up to the time when the children leave school. Elena considers the most difficult part of her job is having to remain under the intense sun during the afternoons. She has been in business for seven years and works alone while her partner has a job operating his motorcycle taxi. What she enjoys most about her work is having the freedom to pursue other activities.

Elena currently wants to expand her store with quality products. She hopes to achieve her goal soon so that she can continue down the path to success and prosperity for the sake of her family. Elena is taking this opportunity to request 600 PEN. She thanks those who made this loan possible so that she can continue toward her goals. Once again, she is very committed to completing her payments on time. The amount she requested will be used to buy a large quantity of groceries that consists of rice, sugar, milk, eggs, and oil. She will also buy a variety of snack foods, fruits, and other products that children consume. In this manner, she hopes to maintain a stable income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food products.

loans.name: Dilma

texts.es:
Doña Dilma  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a su  familia en una comunidad en la zona sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas.
Doña Dilma su negocio es muy conocido en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto sea mucha.  Necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal para seguir elaborando sus tortillas y contar con este ingreso el cual es muy importante para su hogar. 
Doña Dilma espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos. 
Doña Dilma espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia a que tenga una mejor calidad de  vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Diciembre  2013
texts.en:
Doña Dilma is a hardworking and responsible person who lives with her family in a community in southern Honduras. Her business involves making and selling tortillas.

Doña Dilma's business is well-known in her community since there is a great demand for her product. She needs this loan in order to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder so that she can continue making tortillas. Having this income is very important for her household.

Thanks to this loan, Doña Dilma expects to have the supplies needed to continue operating her business and meeting the demand from her customers. In addition, she expects that there will be a great increase in her sales, which will be reflected by a better quality of life for her family and an improved income.

Doña Dilma hopes that her business will keep growing and become the most well-known establishment in her community. This will enable her to continue supporting her family so that they can have a better quality of life.

Choluteca, Honduras – December 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder.

loans.name: Hakimali

texts.ru: Хакимали жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 49 лет. Он женат и имеет одного ребёнка. У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход в семье, Хакимали трудится каждый день. Основным и стабильным бизнесом Хакимали является животноводство. Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом, а также продаёт полученное от скота молоко. Бизнес животноводства приносит Хакимали хороший и стабильный доход. Поэтому он желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Хакимали заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Hakimali is a cheerful 49-year-old who is married with one child.  He and his family live in a rural part of Tajikistan.  Everyone in his family is very close and supportive of one another.  Hakimali makes his living farming livestock; he breeds animals and sells them later for a profit.  He works every day so he can provide for his family, and is helped by his wife, who tends to their animals and sells the milk they produce.  

Raising livestock provides Hakimali with a good, stable source of income.  As such, he'd like to expand his business by buying some more livestock to raise and resell later.  He hopes his business will be able to successfully grow and be able to provide more money to satisfy he and his family's needs, and would like to thank Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more perfume, body cream and baby oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pure water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Pacesa Dolores

texts.es: La Señora Pacesa tiene 45 años tiene 3 hijos que son de las edades de 16, 13 y 11 años, ella se dedica  al venta de carne de cerdo y menudencias tiene su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la zona de Niño Jesús,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro d la institución, la señora Pacesa va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería (carne de cerdo) ya que esta época de año nuevo tiene mucha demanda de este producto,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es gran demanda por época de fiestas de fin de año y año nuevo, la señora Pacesa enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que esta época todos se dedican a vender este producto,  va a utilizar los beneficios ampliar el negocio comprando un frízer para mantener su carne en buen estado, su deseo para su negocio es ser vendedora mayorista de este producto.
texts.en:
Sra. Pacesa is 45 years old and has three children (ages 16, 13, and 11). She sells pork and offal from a vending stall located in the District of Niño Jesús. This loan is her first transaction with Emprender. Sra. Pacesa will use the money to buy more inventory (pork) since there is great demand for this product during the year-end season.

Her reason for requesting this loan is because of the huge demand around the time of the New Years's Eve and New Year's Day festivities. Sra. Pacesa faces challenges with her business, such as dealing with the competition during this time from all of the other vendors who sell this product. She will utilize the profits for expanding her business by purchasing a freezer so that she can keep the meat in good condition.

Her wish for her business is to become a wholesale vendor of this product.

loans.use: to buy pork to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, oil, sugar, and baking powder for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking seasonings and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase variety of traditional medicines to expand her business.

loans.name: Bertrand

texts.en: Bertrand is a young Cameroonian, aged 25. He is single without a child. He has been in this business for over a year which makes him experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase his turnover from 450,000 XAF to 500,000 XAF per month. His standard of living will also be improved.

loans.use: to buy bread, soft drinks, biscuits, tin food, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay laborers to harvest coffee and to clean up his farm

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 29 year old mother of 3 children. She is a farmer and a resident of Kisii, Kenya. She has done farming for 3 years. She produces and sells milk,and vegetables.She enjoys mixed farming because it puts food on her table.
Jackline chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate they charge is low and affordable. During her training she learnt how to develop a savings culture. This loan will give her children better education and improve her family's living standard due to the increased income.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap and toothpaste for her business

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz, age 43, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to support her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase two more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and raise her income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram is 31 years old, and he lives in the village Noratus in the Gegharkunik region. He lives with his parents, wife and his nice children. He works in a military sphere, and at the same time, he is engaged in farming. On his farm, he has two cows, two calves and two heifers. From their home, his mother sells milk, "macun" (a very tasty Armenian national dairy product), cheese and also some meat. Their family income is not very big, and they really need to increase the number of their farm cattle, which will in its turn bring more income for their family.

Aram asks a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a cow and a lot of animal fodder for the winter months.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a lot of animal fodder for the winter months

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more of her products like earrings, combs, necklaces, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 31-year-old married woman who has been doing a business selling milk for the past three years. She has five calves and two cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life.
 
She has four children, and she is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 
 
It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. Now, she has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 36 years old; he lives with his wife and his three children in Asira Shamaliya. Asira Shamaliya is a Palestinian town in the Nablus Governorate, located 6 kilometers north of Nablus in the northern West Bank.

Khaled has a shortage of money, so he asked Ryada for this loan to repair the wall and paint the house, which will help him to take a step forward, and give him more psychological comfort because he has a shortage of money. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to repair the wall and paint the house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, cool water, etc., for her business

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 26-year-old married woman; she has been running a business selling goats for many years. She buys baby goats at low prices, brings them up and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently, she has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase two more baby goats. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, pure water, and toothpaste to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oranges for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour for her business.

loans.name: Hranush

texts.en:
Hranush is from Armavir. She has been providing sewing services to locals for many years. From a small, rented store located in the center of Armavir, she receives different orders and sews different types of clothing. Due to Hranush's hard and tireless work, she has a good list of clients who prefer to order clothing only in her store. Now, by applying for this loan, Hranush asks for financial support to purchase materials needed for her work.

Hranush has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a big support to Hranush, who works hard to satisfy her clients' needs and provide high quality service to them.

loans.use: to purchase materials for sewing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, onions and cooking seasonings for resale

loans.name: Mbah Evodia

texts.en:
Mbah is married with six children; two of whom are not yet fifteen years old. They live in a four bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She faces many problems such as inadequate capital to operate her business, and the deaths of her mother, brother and husband.

She has repaid three loans and will use this new loan to expand her restaurant business to buy ingredients used to fry “gateaux” such as sugar, flour, yeast, vegetable oil, beans, rice, sachet tomatoes, maize and fire wood. 

She holds a positive view of her business and believes that she can succeed because she has experience, regular customers, and she supplies food for birthdays and weddings.   Her business provides the community with a regular supply of food at cheaper rates.

With the profit from this loan, she will educate her children by providing them with all the necessities needed in school, she will care for her family, buy farm seedlings for her small garden in the compound, and also save some for future investments. 

She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rate and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to buy  vegetable oil, flour, beans, corn, and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, flour and fish to expand her business

loans.name: Dildora

texts.ru: Прекрасная девушка из Таджикистана нуждается вашей поддержки. Ее зовут Дилдора и ей 18 лет. Она из семьи колхозника. Ее родители занимаются выращиванием сельхоз культур как пшеница и кукуруза и их доход не достаточно для оплаты обучения Дилдоры в университете, так как в этом году она поступила в университет. Она является студенткой 1 курса Худжандского Государственного Университета факультета Русская филология.  Она должна оплатить годовой договор. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 350 долларов США для оплаты обучения в университете. Она ждет и надеется на вашу доброту.
texts.en: A pretty young lady from Tajikistan is in need of your help.  Her name is Dildora, and she's 18 years old.  She is from a family of farm workers; her parents grow crops such as wheat and corn for a living.  Dildora has enrolled in a university for the year.  She is a freshman at Khudzhan State University and needs to pay for her tuition, but her parents don't make enough money to do so.  To help pay for her education, she's seeking a loan of $350 (USD), and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: pay for her university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, native rice, and beans for resale

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is married with six children and they live in a three bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. 

He has faced many challenges in life including inadequate capital to successfully operate his business, a fire that destroyed his family's house, burglary, the death of his son, and a misunderstanding between family members.

He has repaid two previous loans and he will use this loan to operate a poultry farm and buy chicks, medicine, drinkers, and build a safe place to keep the chicks. 

He has a positive outlook and believes he can be successful because he has contacted closed friends in the business and they shared ideas about proper management.  He has a ready market and he plans to buy a good breed of chicks. 

With this business activity, the community will have a ready supply of chicks at cheaper rates and they will also benefit from the droppings which will serve as fertilizer for their farms.

With the profit from this loan, he will save money for future expansion and care for his family's needs. He prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to buy drinkers, feed, chicks and medicine for a poultry farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pure water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rubber cups, plates, and food containers to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business,

loans.name: Cecilia Stephannie

texts.es: Cecilia de 19 años de edad es madre soltera y habita junto a su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad, hermana y madre. Para ella lo más importante es su hijo y es por el que hace todo lo que este en sus manos para darle mejores condiciones de vida. Posee un pequeño negocio donde vende variedad de productos derivados del elote tales como: riguas, tortas de elote, tamales, atol y elotes asados. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos, tiene tres años de trabajar en el mismo y desea mejorar sus ventas para lo cual es necesario invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de insumos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar mayor cantidad de  insumos (elotes, azúcar, sal, aceite, carbón, etc.) para incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos y de esta forma mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 19, is a single mother and lives with her three-year-old son, sister and mother.  What matters most to her is her son so she does all she can to give him the best living conditions.  She has a small business selling a variety of corn products such as corn cakes, tamales, corn drink and roast corn on the cob.  The business, which she has been running for three years, is her main source of income.

She wants to improve her sales and needs to buy more supplies; so she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy more corn, sugar, salt, oil, coal, etc.  This way she can increase sales volume and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy corn, sugar, salt, oil, coal, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire coffee workers and clean the land.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia de 62 años de edad reside junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 22 y 15 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de lácteos al por mayor y menudeo. Tiene 7 años de experiencia con el negocio y gracias a los buenos productos que ofrece y al carisma con el que trata a sus clientes ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchas personas que cada día la prefieren más. Desea invertir en su negocio ya que quiere satisfacer una mayor demanda con el fin de mejorar sus ganancias. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: leche y sal para preparar el queso y ponerlo a la venta. Tiene plena seguridad que con los ingresos de su negocio logrará pagar la deuda del crédito.
texts.en:
Lucia, 62, lives with her common-law husband and their two children, ages 22 and 15.  She makes and sells dairy products, both wholesale and retail.  She has been in business for seven years and, thanks to the quality products she sells and the charm with which she attends to the customers, she has been able to gain the trust of many people who prefer dealing with her more and more each day.

Lucia wants to invest in her business so she can meet more demand and improve her earnings.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy the ingredients she needs such as milk and salt to make cheese to sell.  She is sure she can pay back the loan with the income from the business.

loans.use: To buy milk and salt to make cheese.

loans.name: Romelia De Jesús

texts.es: Romelia, con 46 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante sola, ya que nunca recibió apoyo del padre. Desde hace aproximadamente 22 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo ropa, juguetes, utensilios de cocina, entre otros. Esta actividad la inició vendiendo mercancía por encargo, pero luego se le presentó la oportunidad de tener su propio local que le adjudicó la autoridad de espacio público. Allí trabaja de lunes a viernes de 9:00 am a 7:00 y, los fines de semana se dedica a trabajar como empleada en una legumbrería de la plaza de mercado de la ciudad, así logra complementar los ingresos que requiere para solventar los gastos familiares. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, camisetas, entre otros), así podrá tener mayor variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en el mes de diciembre, permitiéndole generar mayor nivel de ganancias, a pesar de los desafíos que se le presentan por la competencia desleal y la falta de compañerismo entre los mismos comerciantes del sector. Romelia manifiesta que quiere seguir luchando por el bienestar de su familia y por su principal sueño que es tener un almacén más grande ubicado en otra zona, donde la competencia desleal no le afecte los ingresos con los que sostiene a su familia.
texts.en:
Romelia, 46, is a single mother of four children who raised on her own without any help from their father.  For around 22 years she has worked as an independent merchant, selling clothing, toys, kitchen utensils, etc.  She started the activity by selling merchanise on an order basis, but then had the opportunity to open her own stand through the public space authority.  She works Monday through Friday, from 9:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  On weekends she works as an employee of a vegetable stand at the city market to earn extra income to cover household expenses.

Romelia is requesting a loan to buy merchandise wholesale (blouses, jeans, t-shirts, etc.) so she can stock more variety to satisfy the greater demand in December.  This will allow her to earn more profit.  Despite the challenges she faces with unloyal competition and a lack of camaraderie between the merchants in this sector, Romelia says she wants to continue struggling for her family's well-being.  Her main goal is to have a larger store in another area where the competition will not affect the income that supports her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise wholesale (blouses, jeans, t-shirts, etc.)

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan de 47 años de edad es soltero y habita en casa propia junto a su abuela, mamá y sobrino quienes a la fecha dependen económicamente de él. Posee una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia y además una venta de panes con pollo los cuales son muy demandados por sus vecinos por ser de calidad y a muy buenos precios. Su deseo es mejorar las ventas de sus negocios ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos y desea satisfacer a una mayor demanda. Por lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de artículos de tienda e insumos para la venta de panes con pollo (golosinas, cereales, bebidas, pollo, panes, etc.).
texts.en:
Juan, 47, is single and lives in his own home with his grandmother, mother and a nephew who he supports economically.  He has a small store in his home and also sells chicken sandwiches which are very popular with the neighbors because of their quality and low prices.

His greatest desire is to improve sales, since this business is his main source of income.  He wants to be able to satisfy the growing demand, so he has decided to request a loan through FUSAI to buy store items and supplies to make the chicken sandwiches (sweets, cereals, drinks, chicken, bread, etc.).

loans.use: To buy sweets, cereals, drinks, chicken, bread, etc.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 29-year-old married lady and the mother of three children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. Samina stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from the Kashf Foundation. Samina intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will allow her to sew more dresses to generate a healthier income. Samina is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Cunegunda Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Monserrate, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de  19 y 5 años, la menor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Monserrate tiene un negocio de asadero de pollos en un local que arrienda en el centro de la ciudad, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 14h00 hasta las 22h00, ella también por las mañanas se dedica a venta de ropa y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella sale a ofrecer sus prendas y productos y también vende  en su local. Tiene más de 19  años con su negocio con el cual ayuda a sacar adelante el hogar.
Este crédito es para comprar pollos, sodas y varios viveres para preparar los alimentos así como también ropa y productos Yanbal. Lleva 11 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le da la institución con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un local propio.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the Tosagua credit group meets every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic. Most of its residents work in agriculture and raising animals, because it is an area with a lot of vegetation.
 

Here lives Monserrate. She is 39 years old, married and has two daughters, aged 19 and 5. The youngest goes to school. Her husband is a taxi driver.
Monserrate has a roasted chicken business in a locale she rents in the center of town. She works there every day from 2 PM until 10 PM. She also sells clothing and Yanbal products in the morning (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She goes out to offer her clothing and products and also sells them from her locale. She has had her business for more than 19 years and it helps her to get her household ahead.  

This loan is to buy chickens, sodas and various groceries to prepare the food, as well as clothing and Yanbal products. She has been in this credit group for 11 years and she likes it because of the help the institution gives with the loans. Her dreams are to own her locale.

loans.use: to buy chickens, sodas, various groceries, clothing and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Josefina Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Josefina, tiene 57 años de edad, hace 17 años murió su esposo pero de esa relación tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. 
A Doña Josefina siempre le gusto ganarse la vida a punta de trabajo y esfuerzo y aun mas después que su marido murió ya que tuvo que afrontar los gastos que genera el hogar y la mantención de sus hijos, ella desde esa época hasta la actualidad se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa lugar en el cual también vende jugos, aguas y gaseosas, así siempre saco adelante a sus hijos y  es su forma de ganarse la vida honradamente.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Lleva 13 años en el Grupo De Crédito,  le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para salir adelante. Sus sueños son segur adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the Tosagua credit group meets every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic and most of its residents work in agriculture and raising animals because it is an area with a lot of vegetation. 

Here lives Josefina. She is 57 years old. Her husband died 17 years ago, but from that relationship she has 5 children who are grown and on their own.  Josefina has always liked earning a living through work and effort, even more so after her husband died and she had to face the household expenses and supporting her children. Since that time until now, she has worked as a merchant. She sells all types of clothing and Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She sells door to door and also from her home, where she also sells juice, water, and soda. This is how she always got her children ahead and it is her way of earning an honest living.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothing. She has been in the credit group for 13 years. she likes it because the loans have really helped her get ahead. Her dreams are to get ahead and have good health.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Robert Cesaire

texts.fr: Cesaire est un homme de 26 ans, Marié et père d'un enfant âgé d'un ans. Il a ouvert un restaurant qu'il gère depuis quelques temps dans un quartier de la capitale. IL se ravitaille en détail dans des marchés avoisinant. Ceci ne lui permet pas de satisfaire toute sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir de jour en jour. C'est pour cette raison qu'il s'est tourné vers nous pour solliciter un financement. Dernier lui permettra de se réapprovisionner en produits alimentaires ( spaghetti, farine, haricot et autres...) ceci augmentera non seulement ses ventes mais aussi son bénéfice. bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Cesaire is a 26-year-old man who is married and the father of a one-year-old. He owns a restaurant which he has been running for a while in a district of the capital. He gets his supplies at retail prices at the surrounding markets. This does not allow him to satisfy his consistently growing clientèle, which is why he has come to us to request financing. This would allow him to stock up on food products (flour, sugar, beans, etc.) which would not only increase his sales, but also his profit. Part of this profit would be reinvested in the expansion of his business, and the rest would enable him to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, beans and other food products.

loans.name: Gilmard

texts.fr: Gilmard est un jeune homme âgé de 35 ans père de 4 enfants donc l'aine est âgé de 13 ans et le dernier de 3 mois . Il est commerçant et a ouvert une petite alimentation qu'il gère lui même depuis quelques années dans un quartier de la capitale. C'est grâce à elle qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grâce à son accueil chaleureux et ses relations de bon voisinage, il a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps, et là, il ne parvient plus à la satisfaire totale d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité en ce moment parce qu'il lui permettra d'augmenter le stock des produits de première nécessité( savons, riz, sucre, allumettes, pétrole et autres... Ceci augmentera se ventes mais aussi ses bénéfices. bénéfices qui seront en partie réinvestis dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Gilmard is a young 35-year-old man who is the father of 4 children, the eldest of whom is 13 years old and the youngest, 3 months. He is a retailer and owns a small store which he has been running for a few years in a district of the capital. It is thanks to his business that he is able to meet his family's needs. Thanks to his warm welcome and the good relationships he has with his neighbours, he has been able to build up a loyal customer base over time. Unfortunately, he is no longer able to completely satisfy his clientèle, which is why he needs this loan for his business right now, as it will enable him to stock up on basic products (soap, rice, sugar, matches, petrol etc.). This will increase his sales and also his profit. Part of this profit will be reinvested in the expansion of his business, and the rest will enable him to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy soap, rice, sugar, matches, petrol etc.

loans.name: Yessica Yanira

texts.es:
Yessica, es casada, tiene una hija de 10 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hija, junto a su esposo cubre los gastos familiares, por su parte se dedica a atender su tienda y una granja de aves de corral, es un oficio que aprendió por iniciativa propia, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a hasta las 7:00 p.m., es un negocio que tiene desde hace cinco años, es apoyada por su esposo, una de sus ventajas es que no posee competencia en la zona.
Con la inversión comprará alimentos, vacunas e insumos para la tienda, con lo que tendrá en mejores condiciones la granja y entre los productos que comprara para la tienda están azúcar, arroz, variedad de bebidas, golosinas entre otros, espera surtir el inventario de su negocio para tener mejores ganancias y atraer nuevos clientes.
Aspira a mejorar sus condiciones económicas para cancelar sus deudas, y seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, como  adjetivo tiene darle a su familia mejor alimentación, vestuario y educación.
texts.en:
Yessica is married and has a 10-year-old daughter. They all live together. She and her husband work to cover the home expenses. She has a store and raises poultry, something she learned on her own. She works from 6:00 am until 7:00 pm and has had this business for five years. Her husband supports her, and she has the advantage of not having competitors in the area.

With this loan, she will buy food and supplies for her store and vaccines for her animals, which will be beneficial for her farm. For the store, she will buy sugar, rice, different types of beverages and candies, among other things. She hopes to stock her business in order to increase the profits and attract new customers.

She hopes to improve her financial situation and pay back the debts she has, and to continue strengthening her business. Her objective is to improve her family’s living conditions (better nutrition, clothing and education).

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store and vaccines for her poultry business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María de 36 años de edad habita junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 17 años, 14 años y 5 años de edad.  María se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, la venta la realiza en su lugar de residencia y de manera ambulante. De esta forma junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. María es una mujer emprendedora y desea hacer crecer su negocio invirtiendo en la compra de mayor mercadería para satisfacer una mayor demanda y así incrementar sus ingresos con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de ropa para dama tales como: faldas, blusas, vestidos, camisetas, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento ya que este negocio le permite equilibrar los ingresos del hogar.
texts.en: María is 36 years old. She lives with her life's companion and their three children, aged 17, 14 and 5. María sells new clothing. she sells in her residence and as a street vendor. In this way, together with her life's companion, they support the home financially. María is an enterprising woman who wants to grow her business, investing in buying more merchandise to fill a higher demand and thus increase her income. This will improve her and her family's quality of life. She is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying a variety of clothing for women, such as skirts, blouses, dresses, t-shirts, etc. She hopes to be able to have this loan since this business stabilizes her household income.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, dresses, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a 37-year-old married woman who has sold milk for the past 11 years. She has two milking cows. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to enable her to lead a decent life.

Saira has six children, five of whom are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life and a good education along with food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

This is her sixth year with the Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business due to the support of the foundation. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 55,000 to purchase one more cow. Saira hopes to have an increase in the production of milk, which will ultimately help to generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Carmen Orlinda Aidee

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo  tres hijos pero dos de ellos fallecieron hace varios años atrás, con ella vive su hija que es madre soltera y vive con su pequeño hijo. Su esposo es jubilado.
Doña Carmen es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder contribuir a los gastos que genera su hogar se dedica a la venta ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días ya que también por las tardes ella prepara y vende corviches, tortillas y empanadas para lo cual instala un pequeño puesto afuera de su casa, a este lugar acuden sus clientes en las tardes y noches que es cuando vende sus alimentos, ella  tiene más  de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual le ayuda a su hija que estudia y para los gastos del pequeño.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the Tosagua group meets every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic. Most of its residents work in agriculture and raising animals because it is an area with a lot of vegetation. 

Here lives Carmen. She is 62 years old, married and had three children, but two of them passed away several years ago. Her daughter lives with her. She is a single mother and lives with her young son. Her husband is retired. Carmen is a housewife who in order to earn her own income and contribute to the household expenses, sells all types of clothes, shoes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She works every day and in the afternoons she makes and sells corviches, tortillas and empanadas. For that she has a small stall outside of her house. Customers go there in the afternoon and evenings when she sells her food. She has been doing this for more than 15 years and with it helps her daughter who goes to school, and for the expenses for the little one. 

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, creams and cosmetics. She has been with the credit group since the start and she likes it because of the help they give in getting ahead. Her dreams are to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy shoes, perfume, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Shafqat

texts.en:
Shafqat is a 37-year-old married woman who works from home as a tailor. When Shafqat was not earning an income, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner as her husband was the sole bread winner of the family. 

Shafqat knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her hard work has helped her establish a good clientele but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. For this reason, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and has requested a loan of PKR 20,000. With this loan, Shafqat will be able to purchase a new sewing machine and some spools of thread in various colors. This will enable Shafqat to meet the demands of her customers without fail.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and some spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.fr: Augustin est une homme de 47 ans mariée, père de famille. Il est commerçant et vend des beignets depuis 05 ans dans un quartier de la capitale.Son savoir faire dans ce domaine et les prix pratiqués lui ont permis d'acquerir et fidéliser une clientèle qui s'accroît au jour le jour. Ce qui l'amène à vouloir ce crédit parce que son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle. Grâce à lui,elle pourra augmenter son stock en achetant (des sacs de farine, un bidon d'huile ) .Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie reinvesti dans son activité et le reste sera économisé pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Augustin is a 47-year-old, married man with children.  

He has sold doughnuts in a neighbourhood of the capital city for five years.  His expertise in his trade, and his good prices, have allowed him to build up and retain an ever-growing clientele.  This increasing demand, and his lack of capital, have led Augustin to request this loan.  He will use his loan to buy sacks of flour and a barrel of oil.  The earnings that Augustin makes will be reinvested in his business, and some will be saved to pay for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to increase his stocks of flour, oil and sundry items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Haydee Del Socorro

texts.es: Haydee del Socorro mayor de edad casada con dos hijos aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora con muchos deseos de salir adelante, es una microempresaria la cual tiene en su casa de habitación un taller de reparación de bicicletas así como también realiza ventas de repuestos , anteriormente tenia una pulperia donde ofrecía productos de granos básicos, pero decidió mejor dedicarse por completo a este negocio, que le generaba mayores ingresos, sus compras las realiza al contado en mayoreos de esta localidad, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos los cuales recupera semanal y quincenal lo invertido, por las tardes ella realiza  deliciosas fritangas como: pollo asado, carne asada, tortitas de carnes, enchiladas, tacos, tajadas, maduro frito con queso, entre otros, el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo en la compra de varios tipos y diferentes repuestos para su negocio. Haydee esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Haydee del Socorro is married and has two children under her care. She is originally from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, located in the west of the country. She is known to be an enterprising woman with a strong will to get ahead. She is a micro entrepreneur and runs a bicycle repair shop at home, where she also sells spare parts. She used to have a grocery store where she sold basic grains, but she decided to focus only on the bicycles business, since it was leaving her better profits.

She pays in cash for her supplies and buys them from local wholesalers. Her customers can choose to pay in cash or on credit. She has a fixed customer base and collects her money weekly or fortnightly. In the evenings, she prepares delicious foods, such as roasted chicken, grilled meat, meat cakes, enchiladas, tacos, chips and fried plantain with cheese.

With this loan she wants to increase her working capital and buy different types of spare parts for her business. Haydee appreciates the help that Kiva investors give people with few economic resources.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy different types of spare parts. Also, to invest in her fast food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plantains, fish, chicken, flour, pepper, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy edible products such as cereals, rice, sugar, pasta and more.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 56 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines.  

Isabel is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Isabel has been farming vegetables for three years and earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 25 years old and married with three children.

Jennifer works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as cheese curls, bread, dried fish, chocolates, sugar and other groceries.

Jennifer has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Jennifer aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as cheese curls, bread, dried fish, chocolates, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 34 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Daisy is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Daisy has been farming rice for one year and also earns additional income from selling meat.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 36 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Marivic is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed for her pigs.

Marivic has been pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more groundnuts, palm oil, rice and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more firewood for resale

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Analyn works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. 

Analyn is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc. for her general store business.
